text:
The proposal discusses the use of KPI Options on UMA's platform to divest UNI's community treasury. Here's a summary:

1. A KPI Option is created by collateralizing 1 $UNI token, with the KPI metric tracked being TVL (Total Value Locked). In this example, the starting TVL is $1.5b and the target is $3b by the end of the year.

2. The UNI community treasury can create these KPI options and sell them for stablecoins via a Gnosis auction or other means. The implied value of the option is .5 UNI (current TVL is $1.5b with a target of $3b).

3. The sale funds the treasury with stablecoins, which can then be used to create a secondary market for the KPI Options using Uniswap's AMM pools.

4. At expiry, all KPI options can be settled and stablecoins withdrawn from LP positions.

5. With this strategy, the treasury would have stablecoins (WIN), UNI stakeholders would have incentives to increase TVL (WIN), and stablecoins are beneficial for the long-term success of the UNI protocol (WIN).

The proposal is based on Yam.finance's experience in building synthetics on UMA's platform and managing DAO treasuries. Links to relevant resources are provided for further reading.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to replace an existing Balancer pool with a new one, specifically for wstETH (Lido's liquid staking derivative of Ethereum). The new pool will activate its gauge and kill the current pool’s gauge to encourage migration of liquidity to the preferred pool. The links provided are for further information on wstETH, its governance, oracles, audits, centralization vectors, market history, value, and the specific pool and gauge addresses mentioned in the proposal.

The SILO:ETH Balancer pool will receive incentives to build a primary source of liquidity for the token, as it is more widely integrated by price and DEX aggregators compared to the current SILO:FRAX v2 gauge. The text also mentions an upcoming proposal to allocate ~130k vlCVX to incentivize the SILO:ETH Balancer pool.

text:
This document outlines several proposed changes to the Aave protocol, including:

1. Deployment of the StkGHO Umbrella Safety Module, financed by Aave's excess revenue and with rewards set exclusively in GHO. The Safety Target for this module will be defined by Aave Finance & Risk service providers. The legacy StkGHO safety module cooldown is set to zero, and the Merit Program continues as it exists today to incentivize user migration.

2. End of the StkAAVE GHO discount, introduction of the anti-GHO system, and closure of the LEND chapter. This will occur when the GHO supply reaches 175M and secondary liquidity allows a 10M swap size at 1% price impact.

3. Activation of the Umbrella Atokens Safety Module and initiation of the "Buy and Distribute" AAVENomics. This will happen when Aave Collector net holdings are equal to 2 years' service providers' recurring costs for the past 30 days, and Aave protocol annualized revenue is at 150% of all protocol expenses YTD, including the AAVE acquisition budget and Umbrella budgets. This will finance secondary liquidity for AAVE, end the Legacy Safety Module, create aUSDC and aWETH Umbrella Safety Modules (if validated by governance feedback), and initiate a buy and distribute program for AAVE.

The community is encouraged to provide feedback on this proposal, which will then move to the TEMP CHECK snapshot stage if consensus is achieved. The Aave Chan Initiative has not received any compensation from related parties for drafting this proposal. All rights are waived under Creative Commons Zero (CC0).
label: neutral

text:
The text provided outlines a proposal called "The Banana Bill" within the ApeCoin ecosystem. This bill involves the allocation of 100 million APE for a program named "Banana Program." Here are some key points:

- Up to 65 million APE can be allocated under the Commercial Agreements Initiative in Year 1, and up to 23 million APE can be allocated under the User Incentives Initiative, with a total of 73 million APE being the maximum for the Commercial Agreements Initiative unless approved by the Special Council.
- The funds must be returned to the ApeCoin DAO treasury if not allocated within two years.
- Up to 3 million APE per year can be spent on administrative expenses, including compensation for Advisory Committee members, Program Facilitator, Strategic Accounts Manager, and other consultants or advisors.
- The Advisory Committee will oversee the Banana Program based on its Charter, and the Special Council will oversee both the Banana Program and the Advisory Committee.
- The initial Advisory Committee members, Program Facilitator, and Strategic Accounts Managers are identified in the text. The Special Council may appoint up to two more Advisory Committee members so that the total number does not exceed 7.
- An endorsement by a majority of the Advisory Committee is required for funds allocation under the User Incentive Initiative or Commercial Agreement Initiative, and the Special Council cannot veto it unless in limited, objective circumstances.
- Within 30 days of the Banana Bill passing, the Advisory Committee must submit its Charter for approval by the Special Council, and the Special Council will publish the Banana Program Rules.
- Each quarter during the two-year term, a transparency report will be published detailing the APE allocated under both initiatives and commercial agreements entered into.
- The APE Foundation may structure the execution of the Banana Program as necessary under applicable law.

The full proposal can be found at this link: https://forum.apecoin.com/t/aip-454-the-banana-bill-apes-gotta-eat/24367
label: neutral

text:
This transaction involves several smart contracts and their corresponding role assignments within the Gnosis DAO. Here's a summary:

1. The DAO Multisig (`gno:0x2a5AEcE0bb9EfFD7608213AE1745873385515c18`) will interact with the Authorizer (`0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6`).

2. The DAO Multisig will call `grantRoles` on the Authorizer with the following roles:
   - Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v3 (`0x12068567376f5214f735cd6e477a885e135c8964f6771112086ce1fda7cc475d`)
   - Weighted Pool v3 (`0xbe826ebecfd64701333db6557b090b44c6155461ce9aaf6efce57ad8dc12bd2e`)
   - Composable Stable Pool v3 (`0x9f637c196de3124bc0febbb78f206994fdb68c3f8fe8070b42230a76e14ece0b`)
   - Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v4 (`0xf27a3cfffd6082308886cb5ef66425202d4b3180e84c6852d7d8109b4228a5ec`)

3. These roles correspond to the ability to call `disable()` on the following factories:
   - Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v3 (`0x9dd5Db2d38b50bEF682cE532bCca5DfD203915E1`)
   - Weighted Pool v3 (`0xC128a9954e6c874eA3d62ce62B468bA073093F25`)
   - Composable Stable Pool v3 (`0xC128468b7Ce63eA702C1f104D55A2566b13D3ABD`)
   - Aave Rebalanced Linear Pool v4 (`0x9dA18982a33FD0c7051B19F0d7C76F2d5E7e017c`)

4. Finally, the DAO Multisig will call `disable()` on each of these factories.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses Gauntlet's recommendations to optimize risk and capital efficiency for the Venus protocol. Recommendations include reducing the BNB Collateral Factor from 80% to 75%, increasing borrow caps for BCH from 4,331 to 7,000, and increasing borrow caps for FIL from 122,200 to 180,000. The text explains that these adjustments aim to maintain overall risk tolerance while making risk trade-offs between specific assets. It also mentions potential liquidation risks associated with lowering the collateral factor of BNB and provides supporting data on top borrowers and borrow usage. The text encourages the community to view Gauntlet's Venus Risk Dashboard for a better understanding of the updated parameter suggestions and general market risk in Venus. Overall, the sentiment is informative and focused on risk management and optimization.

text:
The Frax Protocol is a decentralized stablecoin protocol managed by veFXS holders through governance votes on the Frax Finance platform. The protocol's market cap is currently $392,832,760, with a 24h volume of $26,491,511 as of September 19, 2023 (source: Coingecko). Liquidity pools for Frax can be found on FraxswapV2, UniswapV2, and Curve.

The social media presence of Frax includes a Twitter account with 7.7M followers and a Telegram community of around 20k members. The project's activity on Github is relatively low, with only 114 contributors.

Regarding risk parameters, the proposal suggests an Isolation Mode, Borrowable, Collateral Enabled, and LTV of 35%. Other parameters include a Supply Cap (FXS) of 800,000, Borrow Cap (FXS) of 500,000, Debt Ceiling of $4M, Liquidation Bonus and Protocol Fee of 10%, Reserve Factor of 20%, Base Variable Borrow Rate of 0, Variable Slope 1 and 2 of 0.09 and 3.00 respectively, and Uoptimal of 0.45.

The next steps involve gathering recommendations from the Risk Management team and community feedback. If consensus is reached, the proposal will be escalated to the TEMP CHECK Snapshot stage. The project operates under a CC0 license, meaning copyright and related rights have been waived.
label: neutral

text:
In summary, Chaos Labs proposes a 12-month engagement with the Aave community for risk management services. The focus areas include ongoing monitoring and analytics of GHO composition and stability, facilitator's risk framework, and proactive incident response in case of market volatilities or asset depegs.

The team will share their analyses and recommendations through dedicated governance forum discussions, provide monthly updates, and be available for community calls. The total budget is $1.6M, to be paid linearly over the engagement period, with a preference for GHO but open to other stable/AAVE token compositions.

The technical implementation involves creating a stream of 1,600,000 aUSDC or GHO for a 12-month duration using the `createStream()` method of the `IAaveEcosystemReserveController` interface. Chaos Labs currently provides similar services to other DeFi protocols without any conflicts of interest with Aave.

The next steps include gathering community feedback, aiming for a Snapshot vote on November 1st, 2023, and submitting an Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP) on November 8th, 2023, if consensus is reached. The proposal is under CC0 copyright.
label: neutral

text:
1. Overview: The proposal is to add jEUR (Jarvis Euro), a stablecoin pegged to the EUR, on Aave's V3 market on the Polygon network. jEUR uses the EURUSD price feed of Chainlink for settlement and has risk parameters proposed for different modes.

2. Risk Parameters:
   - V3 Efficiency mode EUR stablecoins (if it exists): 97% LTV, 98% liquidation threshold, 10% reserve factor
   - V3 Efficiency mode stablecoins: 90% LTV, 95% Liquidation threshold, 10% reserve factor
   - V3 Isolation mode: 50% LTV, 80% liquidation threshold, 20% reserve factor, 2M$ debt ceiling.

3. Security Specification and Risks:
   - jEUR inherits risks from USDC, UMA’s DVM oracle, and Chainlink.
   - jEUR can only be minted following the protocol rules on Polygon, with no DAO at present, but transitioning to a ve-model in Q2.
   - Audits have been conducted by Halborn and Ubik.

4. Data:
   - Market Cap: €3.5M circulating ($4M)
   - 24h Volume: $2M on primary market, $400k on secondary markets
   - Volatility: Low
   - Maturity: Early
   - Social channels data: Discord: 3k members, Twitter: 16.1k followers
   - Contracts date of deployments, number of transactions, number of holders for tokens: Sep 2021 (Polygon), 116k transactions, 3,242 holders (more possible due to farming programs)

5. Links:
   - Website: [https://jarvis.network](https://jarvis.network)
   - Dune: [Jarvis Dashboard](https://dune.xyz/0xroll/JarvisNetwork)
   - Docs: [https://learn.jarvis.network](https://learn.jarvis.network)
   - Code: [https://gitlab.com/jarvis-network](https://gitlab.com/jarvis-network)

6. Voting options:
   - YES, add jEUR on Aave v3 on Polygon
   - NO, do not add jEUR on Aave v3 on Polygon
label: bullish

text: The text proposes adjustments to nine risk parameters across four Aave V3 Polygon assets, aiming to optimize borrow usage and improve system capital efficiency without increasing potential losses or Variance Risk (VaR) and Extreme VaR. The proposed changes include increasing Loan-to-Value (LTV) and Liquidation Threshold (LT) for WBTC, DAI, LINK, and wMATIC. Simulations suggest a projected borrow increase of approximately 400,000$ with no change in VaR or Extreme VaR compared to the current parameters. The analysis indicates adequate on-chain liquidity for significant liquidations with the updated parameters and no identified outsized positions affecting recommendations.

text: The text discusses a pool on the Polygon network that combines Balancer's AAVE boosted stable pool token (bb-am-USD) and the wstETH-bb-a-WETH pool token. This pool leverages yield-bearing versions of stable coins, such as USDC, USDT, DAI, and wstETH-bb-a-WETH pairing in a 50/50 weighted pool. The goal is to provide a capital-efficient route for liquidity providers (LPs) to maintain exposure to wstETH and stable coins while earning yield through AAVE. The protocol will earn yield on the boosted portion of this pool, making it more efficient for both parties. This pool would be considered a "core pool" under BIP-19, meaning that protocol fees earned by this pool would be used to bribe for votes on it.
label: bearish

The governance of CRE8R DAO is handled by its founding 100 NFT holders through snapshot votes and forum proposals, with specific treasury functions controlled through a multisig. There are no oracles within the CRE8R DAO at this time, and there's no need for market history as CRE8R doesn't run a DeFi protocol with smart contracts. text:
The provided data appears to be a series of function calls made to various smart contracts on the Polygon network. Here's a summary:

- AaveLinearPool (Nov 15, 2022) has set new targets for two parameters.

- StablePool (Jun 24, 2021) has also set a swap fee percentage and started/stopped an amplification parameter update.

text:
The text suggests that the author is critical of PancakeSwap (PCS) for its current strategies, particularly its promotion of Binance Coin (BNB) over Cake (CAKE). The author recommends that PCS should stop using BNB for predictions and start promoting CAKE instead. They also suggest that PCS needs to expand its operations beyond the Binance Smart Chain (BSC), as other platforms have already adopted a multi-chain approach.

The author is concerned about the speed of the PCS website, the need for PCS to own part of liquidity and strengthen its treasury for development, and the high inflationary pressure due to CAKE emissions. They also advise PCS to focus on its core services such as Launchpad, Initial Farm Offerings (IFO), farming, etc., rather than pursuing trends like Non-Fungible Tokens (NFTs). Lastly, they propose that only CAKE pairs should be paid in CAKE, and other pairs should be rewarded with their native tokens.

In summary, the author is advocating for PCS to make significant changes in its strategies, focusing on expanding its use cases, improving its utility, and reducing inflationary pressure to ensure the long-term success of CAKE.
label: bearish

The MLP pool will use BAL as collateral for leveraged traders, with a target weighting of 1%. Risks associated with this proposal include smart contract risk, oracle risk, trader profits, and single-sided asset supply. text:
1. Funding for RToken adoption initiatives such as listings, partnerships, marketing, etc., is under the discretionary control of the Reserve team. However, there's a 4-week delay after initiating each withdrawal transaction on the blockchain. The purpose of the withdrawal is announced either through an on-chain message or social media, and RSR holders can sell their tokens within the 4-week period if they disagree with the purpose.

2. The total supply of RSR cannot be changed, and the contract is un-upgradeable but pausable. The pauser is a Reserve team multisig (3-of-5 safe) located at gnosis-safe.io/app/eth:0xA7b123D54BcEc14b4206dAb796982a6d5aaA6770/home. Pausing will only be done in situations where the token or platform is in danger, and once the platform has reached steady state, pausing will be released to a burn address.

text:
Here is a summary of the provided text:

* The focus for Q2 is to improve BalancerDAO brand awareness and voice.
* Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) for Q2 include sponsoring 2 physical crypto events, holding at least 5 AMAs per month, growing the Balancer DAO account to 5k followers, and submitting 3 entries for Balancer Bounties.
* The plan for Q2 includes putting more order in everything done, creating new campaigns, looking at reward-based NFTs/POAPs, continuing Pools of the Week posts, progressing with veBAL campaign, establishing #BALbattles, incorporating YouTube videos into various posts, and being more active in IRL events.
* The budget for community development is $900 per month, which will be extended through Q2.
* Successes include onboarding a new Baller, launch of community docs, great progress on balancer.tools v2, multi-chain support for Balancer Analytics, and deployment of community subgraphs.
* Learnings include that development always takes longer than expected and writing good documentation is time-consuming.
* KPIs for Q2 include launching info.balancer.fi (analytics), launching balancer.tools v2, writing first community developer documentation on the DAO gitbooks, maintaining, expanding, and supporting further development of documentation as new technologies are implemented.
* BalancerDAO is requesting $127,500 in stables and 21,250 BAL for compensation, $44,900 in stables and 65,925 BAL for budgets outside of Compensation (with 46,425 BAL going to Grants), leaving approximately 500 BAL from the unspent Q1 budget.
* If this vote is approved, the following transactions will be initiated from the DAO Multisig: a transfer of 46,425 BAL to the Grants Multisig, a transfer of $172,400 of bbaUSD to the Ops Multisig, and a transfer of 40,250 BAL to the Ops Multisig.

text:
Summary:

The project discussed is Frax Finance, a decentralized stablecoin protocol built on Ethereum. The purpose of Frax Finance is to create a stablecoin that is collateralized by ETH and other ETH-equivalent assets as the protocol matures. The Frax Price Index (FPI) allows for a shift away from the USD unit-of-account into the first major stable crypto-native unit-of-account.

The FRAX price oracle is served via ChainLink, and FRAX will only be used for depositing and lending with a Loan-to-Value (LTV) value of 0%. The contracts for interest bearing aFRAX, variable Debt variableDebtFRAX, Stable Debt stableDebtFRAX, and Strategy Implementation for FRAX have been generated following the Aave governance docs.

Audits and security reviews have been conducted by Trail of Bits and CertiK. The risk assessment was performed in May 2021 when FRAX's market cap was $110M. The overall risk is rated as B- with Frax Smart Contract Risk, FRAX Counterparty Risk, FRAX Market Risk, and FRAX Overall Risk being C, C+, B, and B- respectively.

References include the whitepaper, website, Twitter, docs, Github, token contract, and a link to Creative Commons Zero (CC0) for copyright information. Test cases are also mentioned but not detailed in this summary.
label: neutral

text:
This text outlines a proposal for the Aave DAO to evolve its Liquidity Committee into the Aave Liquidity Committee, focusing on leveraging excess voting power for tangible rewards through participation in various voting markets.

Key aspects of this proposal include:

1. Diversification of asset categories to reduce dependence on AAVE as a backstop and explore the inclusion of GHO LP assets for rewards from other protocols.
2. A 90-day emission forecast for community feedback, with iterative emission cycles to target specific asset categories and improve correlations between bad debt potential while maintaining a base level of insurance.
3. Capital efficiency improvements through optimizing emission schedules to balance attracting and retaining new deposits for each respective category.
4. Creation of an analytics dashboard to track the effective coverage of the insurance fund under various market conditions, promoting transparency and providing insight into the performance of the Safety Module as an effective insurance fund for the DAO.

The proposal also includes specifications for creating two 180-day streams for 220k and 180k GHO, with TokenLogic and karpatkey periodically claiming a fraction of the budget during the stream duration. Additionally, they will be included in the Gas Rebate program and will jointly lead the GLC upon the AIP onboarding them as service providers passing.

The proposal is not compensated beyond the Aave protocol, with both TokenLogic and karpatkey being delegates within the Aave ecosystem. The copyright and related rights are waived via CC0.
label: bullish

text: The text presents a proposal to whitelist the gauge for a new TetuBAL/20WETH-80BAL pool on Balancer. Tetu is an asset management protocol that offers automated yield farming strategies for users, aiming to provide deep liquidity and incentivize BAL locking within the Balancer ecosystem. The proposal includes references to the project's website, documentation, GitHub page, Discord community, and other resources. It also outlines the governance structure, security practices, centralization vectors, and market history of the pool, including links to audit reports and timelock mechanisms. The gauge for this pool can be found on Etherscan.

The proposal is supported by both FRAX and Beethoven X, and if approved, will bring benefits such as earning protocol fees on interest-bearing sfrxETH in the pool and incentivizing TVL growth with trading volume. The proposal follows governance processes outlined by Frax Finance, and the pool requesting core pool status according to BIP-457.

The addition of FOX is expected to increase platform usage and fees due to its growing presence in the DeFi ecosystem and recent integrations with other platforms. The new ShapeShift V2 platform is open-source, multi-wallet, multi-chain, and designed for complete decentralization. Suggested Aave parameters for FOX are LTV: 55%-65%, Liquidation Threshold: 65-70%, Liquidation Bonus: 8%, Borrowing Enabled: Yes, and Reserve Factor: 25%.

text:
The provided table outlines the estimated timeline and project phases for the Anemoy Liquid Token Fund (LTF) proposal by k/factory team member, a core contributor to Centrifuge protocol. The project involves the creation of a Foundation Company, deployment of $1M into a US Treasuries Fund, and ongoing operations where DAO can vote on increasing allocations for investments.

The legal setup costs are estimated to be up to 50,000 USDC, which will be returned if unused. The proposal aims to break-even within the first 6 months and generate revenue thereafter. There are fees associated with this project, including a portfolio fee of 0.35% p.a. on assets in Prime up to $50M, 0.2% for $50-100M, and 0.1% for >$100M paid to Centrifuge for maintaining the portfolio. Additionally, there will be an Aave Reward of 500 stkAave streamed over 2 years into the Centrifuge treasury.

Since the Temp Check, more details have been provided on the legal framework, Anemoy LTF, and use of funds. Individual and group calls with active delegates and voting participants were hosted to answer questions and provide further context. A public Twitter Space was also held for discussion. This ARFC (Aave Improvement Proposal) has been modified to focus primarily on an initial 1m RWA investment, with further investments explicitly out of scope.

Upon approval, Centrifuge will work with the DAO to implement and execute the AIP. The proposal is written by a member of the k/factory team and copyright is waived via CC0. For more information, refer to the provided resources.
label: bullish

text:
This text outlines a proposal to move funds from various platforms to Aave v3 on Ethereum, migrate assets from Aave v2 to v3, swap certain assets to GHO, and bridge assets from Polygon to Ethereum. The total net transfer of aUSDT and unallocated aEthUSDT is 0.50M aEthUSDT. An additional 1.7M USDC, 0.5M DAI, and 0.75M USDT from Polygon will also be transferred to Ethereum.

The proposal aims to ensure the Immunefi bug bounty program has sufficient funds available if required, and to move Aave in the right direction. The tasks to be performed on Ethereum include depositing 1M DAI into Aave v3, migrating aUSDT, aDAI, and other assets from Aave v2 to v3, swapping certain assets to GHO, and bridging USDC, DAI, and USDT from Polygon to Ethereum.

The funds available to support new expenses after implementing the proposal will include more than 1.25M of aEthUSDT, more than 1.8M of aEthDAI, more than 1.5M of GHO, and more than 1.0M of aEthUSDC.

The next steps involve reaching consensus on ARFC stage, escalating to ARFC snapshot stage if consensus is reached, and if the outcome is YAE, escalating to AIP stage. The priority is to ensure the DAO is sufficiently capitalized for the next 6 months. A publication relating to the DAO's overall budget allocation will be shared during Q4 2023.

TokenLogic receives no compensation beyond Aave protocol for the creation of this proposal, and TokenLogic is a delegate within the Aave ecosystem. The text is under CC0 copyright.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses a proposal to improve the oracle system in AAVE, a decentralized lending and borrowing platform. Currently, the prices of assets are calculated using Chainlink oracles which convert all asset prices directly to ETH, leading to potential higher liquidation risks for users due to the design of the oracle updates. The proposal suggests calculating stablecoin asset prices using lower variance price feeds, converting assets to their pegged equivalents before converting the price to ETH. This change would reduce the impact of the USD to ETH price volatility on debt ratios between pegged assets. The aim is to make the platform more stable and user-friendly.
label: bearish

text:

* Reducing the base rate of emissions by 13% over 13 weeks
* Migrating 90% of Sushi ibBTC/WBTC pool rewards, with a new Launch Boost structure
* Adjusting multipliers for renBTC, Tricrypto, and Sushi WBTC/ETH on different platforms
* Changing the multiplier for bcvxCRV, adjusting blCVX emissions, and boosting underlying yield on it
* Transitioning from incentivized liquidity on Uniswap V2 to Treasury Controlled Liquidity on Uniswap V3
* Halting rewards on bCVX and bBadger
* Reserving up to 100,000 Badger for adding new Setts with Badger Council approval.

text:
The provided tables represent two proposed interest rate models (Curve #1 and Curve #2) for a decentralized lending and borrowing platform like Aave. Both curves aim to address the over-approximation of an existing 10,000% interest curve by reducing the Slope2 parameter.

   Curve #1 focuses on setting a higher optimal utilization rate and a maximum APY that reduces the potential for extended periods at 100% utilization while maintaining a more gradual increase in interest rates above the optimal utilization rate.

   Curve #2 adjusts its parameters to have a maximum APY similar to the intended APY in AIP-26, resulting in a higher likelihood of periods at 100% utilization compared to curve #1. This curve is designed to mimic the intended APY mentioned in AIP-26 more closely.

   The charts show how the APY changes based on the utilization rate for both proposed curves. As the utilization rate increases, so does the APY, with significant jumps occurring around the optimal utilization rate (80% in this case). Both curves have a maximum effective APY of 10151.40%, which is derived from the provided Slope2 parameter and the given optimal utilization rate. However, curve #2 has a higher likelihood of reaching this maximum APY due to its adjusted parameters.
label: bearish

text:

text:
1. The DAO Multisig (0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f) will initiate a transaction to the Authorizer (0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6), granting it the role for calling add_gauge on the GaugeController (as seen here: https://github.com/balancer-labs/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/master/pkg/deployments/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L358). This allows the DAO Multisig to directly add gauges to the controller.

2. The DAO Multisig will interact with the AuthorizerAdaptor (0x8F42aDBbA1B16EaAE3BB5754915E0D06059aDd75) and call performAction with the GaugeController (0xC128468b7Ce63eA702C1f104D55A2566b13D3ABD) for the target(address) argument. The data(bytes) argument will be 0x3a04f900 followed by the gauge address (0x56124eb16441A1eF12A4CCAeAbDD3421281b795A) and the corresponding gauge type.

3. The DAO Multisig will initiate a transaction to the Authorizer (0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6), renouncing the role for calling add_gauge on the GaugeController as seen here: https://github.com/balancer-labs/balancer-v2-monorepo/blob/master/pkg/deployments/action-ids/mainnet/action-ids.json#L358). This removes the ability for the DAO Multisig to directly add gauges to the controller.
label: neutral

2. Emission schedule: Users can mint MAI by locking up their assets and borrowing against that value at 0% interest. Temporary debt ceilings serve as a supply mitigation.
3. Token & Protocol permissions (minting) and upgradability: All funds stored as collateral are fully controlled by users. There is a 3/5 multisig, comprised by the QiDao team. The multisig executes the results of Snapshot votes: liquidation ratios for new collaterals, partnerships, and debt ceilings.

Social channels data: Project: https://www.mai.finance/, Defillama: https://defillama.com/protocol/qidao, Whitepaper: https://docs.mai.finance/, Document portal: https://docs.mai.finance/, Source code for the system(s) that interact with the proposed asset: https://github.com/0xlaozi, Twitter: 17k followers: https://twitter.com/QiDaoProtocol, Telegram: 2,130 members: @QiDaoProtocol, Discord: 8,987 members: https://discord.com/qidaoprotocol

text:
The text discusses a problem with Uniswap's governance system on the Arbitrum network. Due to a misconfiguration caused by miscommunication between developers, the Uniswap Factory on Arbitrum was deployed with an incorrect owner address that cannot be controlled. This has resulted in nobody being able to execute governance proposals on Arbitrum at present.

Arbitrum proposes a solution involving a temporary exception to disable address-aliasing for messages from the L1 TimeLock contract, followed by a cross-chain message from the L1 Timelock contract to set the owner of the L2 Uniswap factory to the correct alias. Once this is completed and aliasing is re-enabled, cross-chain governance between Uniswap and Arbitrum will be functional again. The success of this proposal could strengthen the relationship between the two projects on Arbitrum.
label: bullish

text: The text proposes a solution to address the issue of inflationary dumps in PancakeSwap's native token, CAKE, by retiring the locked pool and implementing a new flexible all-in-one pool. This pool combines various syrup pool rewards, a portion of CAKE emissions, and a percentage of platform revenue share. The change aims to incentivize long-term holding, reduce CAKE emissions, increase APR, and promote user engagement and confidence on the platform. The new pool is expected to have a positive effect on the overall price of CAKE by moving towards a deflationary model and increasing demand for CAKE due to its flexibility. Additional steps suggested include developing further utilities and burn mechanisms, and increasing the allocated buyback and burn fund during market downturns.
label: neutral

text: The text describes a proposal by the Across team to add gauge support for a new wstETH/ACX pool on Ethereum, aiming to strengthen the relationship between Across and Balancer protocols. The Across team intends to establish strong initial liquidity, encourage long-term LPs, and use Balancer as the primary liquidity hub. This is expected to create a sustainable liquidity solution for the protocol and community. Across is an optimistic insured bridge that relies on a decentralized group of relayers to fulfill user deposit requests from EVM to EVM networks. The goal of Across is to become the most-used bridge in Web3.
label: bullish

text:
This text appears to discuss the deployment of a new 2 EUR stablecoin pool on various blockchain networks, including Polygon, Ethereum, Gnosis Chain, Binance Smart Chain, Avalanche, and Optimism. The pool will be either a single pool with multiple assets (2 EUR - bb-am-usd) or a multi-currency pool (2 EUR - 2 EUR - 2 EUR - 2 EUR - bb-am-usd), depending on the liquidity and risk tolerance of the liquidity providers (LPs).

The governance for these pools will be handled differently based on the platform:
- Jarvis has no on-chain governance, with decisions being executed through a ⅝ multi-sig.
- Angle Protocol uses a 4/6 multisig and does not currently have on-chain governance.

The pools will use Chainlink price feeds for EURUSD and computed ETHUSD and EURMAI (ETHUSD / EURUSD and EURUSD * MAIUSD) for jEUR, while agEUR uses only the EURUSD Chainlink price feed.

The pools will be audited by Jarvis (https://learn.jarvis.network/risks-warning/audits) and Angle (https://docs.angle.money/resources/audits).

The centralizing vector for these pools is that jEUR is mainly collateralized by USDC, while bridged agEUR is partially collateralized by USDC.

These pools have been live since August 2021 (for jEUR) and have never traded off their peg. The purpose of the pools is to act as a main route for arbitrages and to facilitate on-chain liquidity, credit without FX risks, etc.

The contracts for the 2 EUR Balancer Pool (Polygon), jEUR token (Polygon), jEUR Synthereum Liquidity Pool, agEUR token (Polygon), and Gauge are provided in the text.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses a proposal to add gauge support for a newly created qETH/ETH pool on Ethereum, introduced by Tranchess - a yield-enhancing asset tracker launched on BNB Chain in June 2021. The proposed pool aims to provide enhanced yield for users on Ethereum and facilitate smooth user experience. The governance token for Tranchess is CHESS, which users earn by staking with the platform. The proposal includes a veBAL gauge to incentivize users and build liquidity of the pool at its initial stage. The qETH/ETH pool would be the primary source of liquidity for Tranchess ETH liquid staking fund. The previous vote for an uncapped gauge failed, but this time it is proposed with a 2% emissions cap.

text:
1. To own a Pancake Squad NFT, you can participate in the Private Sale or Public Sale of the PancakeSwap platform.

2. In the Private Sale, the maximum amount of funds that can be committed per user is $1250 and the final allocation received will depend on the total amount raised during this session.

3. The Public Sale is open to all but comes with a participation fee which will be fully burned. There's also an overflow multiplier for the WOM IFO.

4. The WOM Syrup Pool allows users to stake CAKE tokens to earn WOM. The total tokens are 6,000,000 WOM and the distribution duration is 60 days. For the first 5 days, you need an active PancakeSwap Profile to stake in the IFO Syrup Pool. After that, there's no requirement for a PancakeSwap Profile.

5. There will also be a WOM-BUSD farm with 2x CAKE rewards for the first 48 hours and thereafter, 1x CAKE rewards. The rewards will be removed at the end of the 60-day period unless certain metrics are comparable to other farms.

6. To learn more about the project, you can visit their official channels which include their website, Twitter, Discord, Telegram, Docs, Medium, and audit reports from Hacken, Peckshield, and Zokyo.

7. Be aware of potential scams as WOM tokens will not be available for trading before or during the IFO. Always verify the token address before buying tokens. If you receive a WOM token airdrop from another address, it's probably a scam.

8. A disclaimer is given that all projects are subject to high market risk and volatility. Please do your own research and buy with caution. PancakeSwap will not be held responsible for any investment losses.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal for Balancer's transition to a fully decentralized governance model through Balancer V2 multisig. The multisig is being deployed using Gnosis Safe and its signers are respected community members. Signers are expected to ratify decisions within two weeks of a snapshot vote, and may be removed for acting against off-chain votes or inactivity. In the long run, the multisig will be replaced by a full-fledged Balancer DAO. The multisig will not have control over funds from liquidity providers.

text: The text discusses the creation of a pool on Balancer, which includes two boosted stable pool tokens: bb-a-USD and bb-a-TUSD. This pool is more efficient for TrueUSD as it has previously deployed liquidity with Balancer. The pool will earn yield on both boosted portions, making the token pairing more efficient for both parties. The gauge will be a "core pool" under BIP-19, meaning protocol fees earned by this pool will be used to bribe for votes on it. The gauge can be uncapped based on the nature of the pool and market cap of TrueUSD. This move is part of Balancer's strategy to dominate the yield bearing token space and increase capital efficiency. USDC and TUSD are centralized and do not have a governance forum, but this implementation will draw in new volume and showcase the power of these pool types.

text:
The text discusses an adjustment proposal for the variable slope1 parameter in Aave v2 and v3 markets across multiple chains to align optimal utilization rates with market conditions. This adjustment aims to lower borrowing rates while increasing supply rates, which could help prevent market size growth constraints due to insufficient supplier incentives and low borrower liquidity.

The proposed changes include setting the slope1 parameter for USDC, USDT, FRAX, sUSD, GUSD, LUSD, USDP in Ethereum v2 and v3 markets; DAI, MAI, and FRAX in Avalanche v2 and v3 markets; USDC, USDT, DAI, and MAI in Polygon v2 and v3 markets; and USDC, USDC.e, USDT, DAI, LUSD, FRAX, and MAI in Optimism v3 and Arbitrum v3 markets. The Base and Metis v3 markets will see an increase in the USDC slope1 parameter.

The text also includes a disclaimer stating that Block Analitica is not representing this proposal on behalf of any third party and is not compensated for creating it. It also mentions that the assets or protocols referenced are mentioned purely for illustrative purposes, and this is not a recommendation or solicitation to engage with any asset or protocol.

Finally, the text includes a Creative Commons CC0 waiver, which means that the copyright and related rights in this work have been waived, and it is now in the public domain. This means you are free to share, adapt, and build upon this work, even for commercial purposes, all without asking permission.
label: neutral

text:
The ABI-encoded calldata for the provided transaction data is:

   `0xddf252ad1be2c89b69c2b068fc378daa952ba7f163c4a11628f55a4df523b3ef`

This can be reproduced by running the provided Hardhat script, which computes the roles and encodes the calldata for the `grantRoles` function call. The script sets up the necessary contracts using the Balancer deployments, computes the roles as action IDs, encodes the calldata, and then logs both the function call and the encoded data.

text: The text discusses a mechanism for burning a cryptocurrency called "cake" in a non-reclaimable manner, with the aim of reducing its circulating supply and potentially eliminating its emissions over time. This is achieved through a cake burner pool where players can contribute their cake, which will continuously farm more cake while simultaneously burning it. The more cake added to the pool, the more it farms and burns. The example provided illustrates that if an APY of 50% (annual percentage yield) is maintained for ten years with a single initial contribution of 1,000 cake, it would result in the burning of approximately 57,000 cake, effectively reducing emissions.

text:
This summary outlines the process of depositing tokens into a contract, as demonstrated by Tribe DAO's swap of TRIBE for INDEX. The key steps are:

1. A specific amount of aBAL (1,890 at the time of writing) is held in the Reserve Factor. This aBAL will be redeemed for BAL and combined with 200,000 BAL tokens obtained via the proposed swap.

2. The received BAL is transferred to the Reserve Factor. Then, both BAL and an equivalent amount of ETH are deployed into the BAL : ETH pool on Balancer V2.

3. The BPT token (Balancer Pool Token) is deposited into the veBAL contract and locked for 1 year.

4. The veBAL holding is utilized to direct incentives towards new aToken Boosted Pools.

References:
[1] https://forum.balancer.fi/t/introducing-vebal-tokenomics/2512
[2] https://pools.balancer.exchange/#/pool/0xc697051d1c6296c24ae3bcef39aca743861d9a81/

text:
Bifrost, a decentralized finance (DeFi) platform, launched its vETH 1.0 asset on the Ethereum network on November 27, 2020. Since then, it has been listed on various decentralized exchanges such as Uniswap, Loopring, and DODO.

Bifrost aims to create a vETH/ETH pool on Balancer as its primary source of liquidity for vETH on Ethereum. This is expected to increase volume and trading fees for Balancer.

On July 3, 2023, the old gauge for vETH will be killed. This transaction involves two multisigs: the Balancer Maxi LM Multisig and the DAO Multisig. The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 to add a new gauge for vETH, while the DAO Multisig will interact with the AuthorizerAdapterEntryPoint to kill the old gauge 2 weeks after the execution of this transaction.

The addresses for these interactions are:
- Balancer Maxi LM Multisig: eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860
- GaugeAdderv4: 0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd
- DAO Multisig: eth:0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f
- AuthorizerAdapterEntryPoint: 0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA
- Gauge: 0x1d157Cf1F1339864A3C291D1Bbe786d6Ee682434
- Kill function data: 0xab8f0945 (corresponds to the kill() function)
- Target for killing old gauge: 0x8a88C1f44854C61a466aB55614F6A7778473418b
label: neutral

text:
Title: Migration of Safety Module (SM) Infrastructure to Balancer V2 and Introduction of New Pool Options for Aave's Yield Aggregator

Summary: This proposal discusses the migration of Aave's Safety Module (SM) infrastructure from Balancer V1 to Balancer V2 (BGD). The new pool options will be based on either AAVE/wETH or AAVE/wstETH. If Balancer receives 50% of wstETH yield as revenue, and other conditions are met, Aave could receive a maximum of 250K BAL over the lifetime of the program. The migration process requires users to activate cooldown, unstake BPT v1, withdraw liquidity, deposit on the new pool, and restake.

Voting options include:
- YAE - 80/20 AAVE/wETH
- YAE - 80/20 AAVE/wstETH
- NAE - Rework Proposal
- ABSTAIN

The SM architecture upgrade to support the launch of GHO is currently being progressed by bgdlabs, with details available [here](https://governance.aave.com/t/bgd-abpt-balancer-v2-migration-plan/8381). The Llama team has contributed to this proposal but are not compensated by any of the mentioned communities outside of Aave and do hold small holdings in those communities' tokens.

The full details, including technical specifications and references to related Llama publications, can be found in the forum post [here](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-146-incentivize-8020-bpt-staking-ve8020/4210) and its amendment [here](https://forum.balancer.fi/t/bip-225-amendment-to-bip-146-incentivize-8020-bpt-staking-ve8020/4543).
label: neutral

text:
1. The natural yield of graviAURA and underlying vlAURA in Balancer pools is based on their fixed weight, without the need for external voting. However, initial capital or incentives may be required to bootstrap pools.

2. Changes to BadgerDAO's voting and farming strategies around Balancer will include:
   - Splitting free votes controlled by the Treasury between graviAURA pools initially.
   - Moving POL farming BAL from the BADGER/WBTC pool to the BADGER/graviAURA pool (if all gauges pass).
   - Directing any fucoolture bribes only to graviAURA pools, and offering them on an Aura focused bribe market if possible.

3. BadgerDAO's governance structure includes a hierarchy of multisig accounts with specific use cases, the highest risk operations being controlled by a timelock address with a 2-day delay. The potential risk is misdirection of all graviAURA votes for one voting round due to this centralized element.

4. Badger does not rely on external oracles and has undergone several audits, including the Quantstap audit for Vaults 1.5 and C4 contests for graviAURA strategy and bveCVX strategy (results pending). Additional audit results can be found on badger.com under "Security & Audits".

5. Badger utilizes upgradeable contracts, protected by a 2-day timelock, and centralized entities host the API and frontend. However, they are developing a permissionless IPFS hosted access point for strategy development.

6. The EOA controlling voting in AURA is currently only accessible to 2 senior members of the Badger team and the bot which runs the voting script. Badger will work with Aura to decentralize snapshot voting as much as possible.

7. AURA, graviAURA, and auraBAL are new tokens focused on the Balancer ecosystem without significant liquidity or trading history. The purpose of these gauges is to help build that. Eth has proven market history and is well-traded.

8. Badger is the governance token of BadgerDAO, currently traded in an 80/20 BADGER/WBTC Balancer pool. The treasury maintains additional Protocol owned liquidity on Curve and Uniswap V3, and BADGER is well-traded across several centralized exchanges.

9. A new gauge (33auraBAL-33graviAURA-33WETH) will be introduced.

text:
The case study presented here compares the performance of the Balancer Automated Market Maker (BAL) pool on Multichain and hypothetically on Across, a cross-chain liquidity protocol.

In the Multichain BAL pool, there were 34 transfers over a period of 53 days, with 14 withdrawals. The sizes of the 6 largest withdrawals ranged from 12,323 to 1,339 BAL, and the other 8 were less than 1,000 BAL. The pool is now effectively shut down due to low liquidity (only 484 BAL available).

If Balancer were using Across, all 14 withdrawals would have been completed without issue, and the relayer would have been rebalanced within 2-4 hours, ready for more transfers. For 12 of the 14 transfers, users would have received their BAL on Ethereum in 1-4 minutes. For the two largest transfers, it would have taken 2-4 hours. Over the 53 days, the Across LP would have been replenished approximately 7 times, allowing for significantly higher volumes of transactions compared to Multichain.

The Balancer treasury currently holds 80k BAL in Multichain. If they switched to Across, the treasury could take back 40,000 tokens, support over five times the volume at a fraction of the cost, and maintain operational status. The fees on Across are approximately 0.12%, compared to a 12% fee (100x more) on Multichain for moving 100 BAL from Ethereum to Multichain. If Balancer treasury wanted Across to have a fee of 0.10% or lower, they could specify a lower LP fee.

Across has three fees: the LP Fee (configurable via a rate model), the Relayer Fee, and the Destination Gas Fee. The total Across fee mentioned earlier is approximately 0.12%, which is the sum of the LP Fee and the Relayer Fee. This number will be higher when going to Ethereum due to gas costs that scale up quickly as a percentage of the transfer amount for smaller transfers.
label: bearish

text:
The text discusses a proposal to re-enable the Overnight Pulse gauge on Optimism, a platform for yield farming and decentralized finance (DeFi). Overnight.fi is an asset management protocol that specializes in delta-neutral strategies and offers USD+, a 100% collateralized stablecoin. The collateral of USD+ consists of yield-generating DeFi strategies, including lending to Aave and stable-to-stable strategies.

The Overnight Steady Accord is an implementation of Overnight Pulse that relies on USD+ for yield. In March 2023, the gauge for Overnight Pulse pool on Optimism was enabled following a positive vote. The proposal aims to re-enable the gauge after changes to its codebase.

Overnight Pulse has been successful in driving volumes and TVL (Total Value Locked) to Balancer’s ecosystem, with up to 7M TVL and daily trading volumes ranging from 300-500K on Optimism. The yield was consistently around 12-14% APR, with the majority generated by USD+ rather than rewards.

The pool is expected to generate significant trading volumes and fees for Beets/Balancer, as well as sustainable incentives. Incentives are required to grow the pool's TVL to a level where USD+ yield represents the majority of the pool's APR. The proposal suggests using the Balancer Maxi LM Multisig eth:0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860 to interact with the GaugeAdderv4 and call the addGauge function to re-enable the gauge.

This proposal is for the Ecosystem Operations and Development Workstream, which aims to streamline contributor rewards and project management for PrimeDAO, DAOhaus, The DAOist, Kolektivo, and BalancerDAO.

The team consists of Luuk (Senior Ecosystem Developer), Will (Strategic Consultant and Project Manager), Jaap (Senior Graphic Designer), and CryptoComical (Designer). They have extensive experience in the DAO space, DeFi, and ImpactDAO.

The budget for this proposal is $108,000 per quarter, distributed across Ecosystem Development, Design, and Expenses. The Ecosystem Development will have an 0.8 FTE equivalent of contributors, while the Design team will have a 1 FTE equivalent.

The proposal includes Balancer vests for fixed contributors equal to 50% of their fixed rewards. These vests are valued in absolute BAL numbers and will be distributed pro-rata based on their fixed rewards. The veBAL incentives will also be issued based on the milestones accomplished by the Ecosystem Ops and Development Workstream.

The team plans to follow an iterative proposal process, absorbing learnings in the coming months and actively supporting BalancerDAO in creating a multi-year ecosystem strategy for 2023. They will document their learnings and publish them to the wider community, similar to the process they followed in the Grants Sub-DAO.

text:
Title: Proposal to Approve Credit Lines for deBridge

   Technical Implementation: The integration with AAVE Pools will be facilitated through a dedicated deAaveAdapter smart contract developed by the deBridge team and audited by Halborn. This smart contract uses the deBridge generic messaging protocol and interacts with AAVE Pools across different blockchains. It enables cross-chain swaps, ensuring that liquidity lent from Portals on one chain is always backed by the same amount of asset locked in deAaveAdapter on another chain.

   Proposed Credit Lines: The credit lines to be allocated to deBridge are requested for each blockchain where AAVE v3 is deployed. deBridge is currently deployed on 6 blockchains, and the integration with Portals will help match the supported blockchains. The maximal amount of the cross-chain swap that can be performed by users and protocols in one transaction is capped by the amount of approved credit line, with deBridge paying a 2bps fee on all liquidity taken from the Portals.

   Incentives: An incentive program may be approved by the deBridge DAO after the deBridge token goes live.

   Audits & Security: deBridge has passed four independent security audits by reputable companies such as Halborn, Zokyo, Ackee Blockchain, and Neodyme. It also has a long-term partnership with Halborn for ongoing smart contract audits. There have been no outages, downtime, or exploits/hacks on any networks.

   Voting:
      FOR: DO Approve Credit Lines for deBridge
      AGAINST: DO NOT Approve Credit Lines for deBridge
label: neutral

text:
Title: Balancer Gauge Addition on Arbitrum Network

   Description: The provided information details the addition of new gauges to the Balancer Liquidity Management (LM) Multisig contract on the Arbitrum network. This transaction involves adding two new gauges for Molandak and another gauge for a pool named Child Gauge.

   Key Components:

   1. **Child Gauge**: The Child Gauge is associated with the pool [0xd2b6e489ce64691cb46967df6963a49f92764ba9000200000000000000000545](https://app.balancer.fi/#/arbitrum/pool/0xd2b6e489ce64691cb46967df6963a49f92764ba9000200000000000000000545). The Child Gauge address is [0xFD9D8729a7dBfb8Abd473ce8A0f18326EC713601](https://arbiscan.io/address/0xFD9D8729a7dBfb8Abd473ce8A0f18326EC713601).

   2. **Root Gauge**: The Root Gauge is associated with the Child Gauge. Its address is [0xf8aE0F56f7f95f6D3B773799ee85724efD651583](https://etherscan.io/address/0xf8aE0F56f7f95f6D3B773799ee85724efD651583).

text:
The provided JavaScript code is using the ethers.js library to encode the function call `grantRoles()` of a contract named `authorizer`. This function takes two arguments: an array of role identifiers and an account address. In this case, it grants the roles `manageUserBalance`, `joinPool`, `exitPool`, `swap`, and `batchSwap` to the account with address `0xdcdbf71A870cc60C6F9B621E28a7D3Ffd6Dd4965`.

The role identifiers are computed using the `solidityKeccak256()` function, which is a way to generate a hash of a given input in Solidity. The input for this function is an array containing the name of the contract method (in this case, the name of the role) and the interface of another contract (in this case, the `vault` interface).

The encoded data for the call can be found at the end of the script:

```

```

This is the ABI-encoded calldata for the function call.

text:
Title: Aave Proposal to Adjust Slope 2 and Reserve Factor Parameters

   Summary: This proposal aims to adjust the Slope 2 and Reserve Factor (RF) parameters in the Aave protocol. The change in Slope 2 is due to a reduction in the Uoptimal parameter, which lowers the gradient of the borrow rate between Uoptimal and 100% utilization. To maintain the current gradient, Slope 2 is revised higher. This adjustment is made to counteract the increased deposit rate caused by an increase in the borrow rate, without significantly increasing the borrowing cost.

   The proposal also suggests increasing the RF to be the average of proposed DAI and USDC RFs due to abnormally high USDT usage. This change aims to reduce the deposit rate of USDT, encouraging migration while avoiding a substantial increase in the borrowing cost by shifting utilization onto the steeper portion of the yield curve.

   The tables provided detail the proposed parameter changes to achieve these outcomes. It is important to update these numbers before any AIP submission to avoid unfavorable parameter configurations.

   Note: The author, TokenLogic, is only paid by Aave DAO via Butter as part of the Incentivised Delegate Campaign. The work is licensed under CC0.
label: neutral

text:
This text outlines a proposal to make changes in the CRV Reserve on Polygon v2, v3, Ethereum v2, and the soon-to-be-deployed Ethereum v3 liquidity pool. The main adjustments include:

1. Increasing the SupplyCap and BorrowCap for Polygon v3.
2. Changing the slope parameters (Slope1, Slope2) to 14% and 150%, respectively, after the Optimal point, resulting in a less volatile interest rate for users with increasing utilization. The base rate is set at 3%.
3. Increasing the Reserve Factor on Polygon v3 from 10% to 20%, bringing it in line with all other Aave deployments.
4. Updating the Optimal point (Uoptimal) for all versions to 80%.

The table below shows the current and proposed changes for each version:

| Version | Parameter | Current (%) | Proposed (%) |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| Polygon v3 | SupplyCap | 937.70K | 1,125.24K |
| Polygon v3 | BorrowCap | 640.44K | 1,012.72K |
| Polygon v3 | Uoptimal | 45 | 80 |
| Polygon v3 | Base | 0 | 3 |
| Polygon v3 | Slope1 | 7 | 14 |
| Polygon v3 | Slope2 | 300 | 150 |
| Polygon v3 | Reserve Factor | 10 | 20 |
| Polygon v2 - Frozen | Uoptimal | 45 | 80 |
| Polygon v2 - Frozen | Base | 0 | 3 |
| Polygon v2 - Frozen | Slope1 | 7 | 14 |
| Polygon v2 - Frozen | Slope2 | 300 | 150 |
| Polygon v2 - Frozen | Reserve Factor | 20 | 20 |
| Ethereum v3 - Not yet deployed | Uoptimal | NA | 80 |
| Ethereum v3 - Not yet deployed | Base | NA | 3 |
| Ethereum v3 - Not yet deployed | Slope1 | NA | 14 |
| Ethereum v3 - Not yet deployed | Slope2 | NA | 150 |
| Ethereum v3 - Not yet deployed | Reserve Factor | NA | 20 |
| Ethereum v2 - Frozen | Uoptimal | 45 | 80 |
| Ethereum v2 - Frozen | Base | 0 | 3 |
| Ethereum v2 - Frozen | Slope1 | 7 | 14 |
| Ethereum v2 - Frozen | Slope2 | 300 | 150 |
| Ethereum v2 - Frozen | Reserve Factor | 20 | 20 |

References:
[1] <https://app.aave.com/reserve-overview/?underlyingAsset=0x172370d5cd63279efa6d502dab29171933a610af&marketName=proto_polygon_v3>

text:
The proposal outlines the use of KPI Options to divest UNI's community treasury. Here's a summary:

1. **Creation of KPI Options**: The UNI community treasury collateralizes 1 $UNI token and creates a KPI Option with a target TVL of $3b by the end of the year, with a current TVL of $1.5b. This implies an option value of .5 UNI.

2. **Sale of KPI Options**: The options are sold for stablecoins through a Gnosis auction or other means, funding the treasury.

3. **Secondary Market**: The stablecoins obtained are used to create a secondary market for the KPI Options using Uniswap's AMM pools.

4. **Settlement at Expiry**: At expiry, all KPI options are settled and stablecoins are withdrawn from LP positions.

5. **Treasury Benefit**: The treasury now has stablecoins, effectively winning.

6. **Incentives for UNI Stakeholders**: UNI stakeholders have incentives to increase TVL, also winning.

7. **Role of Stablecoins**: Stablecoins are crucial for the long-term success of the UNI protocol, as they provide a stable foundation for transactions and investments.

text:
This transaction involves multiple interactions between different smart contracts on the Ethereum blockchain:

1. The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig (0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860) will interact with the GaugeAdder v4 (0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd) and call the `addGauge` function. The gauge being added is at 0x597AEbfe41dCc042db206Eb888c42560a22c9303, with a type of Ethereum.

2. The Balancer DAO Multisig (0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f) will interact with the Authorizer (0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6) and call `grantRole` with the role 0xae60dce27f51ce5815357b9f6b40f200557867f8222262a1646c005d09b7dfba. This role corresponds to the `setRelativeWeightCap(uint256)` on mainnet gauges, allowing the account (0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f) to change gauge weights.

3. The Balancer DAO Multisig (0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f) will interact with the AuthorizerAdaptorEntryPoint (0xf5dECDB1f3d1ee384908Fbe16D2F0348AE43a9eA) and call `performAction`. The target is the PAR/EURA root gauge (0x597AEbfe41dCc042db206Eb888c42560a22c9303), with data 0x10d3eb040000000000000000000000000000000
label: neutral

text:
The provided text describes two parts of an airdrop program configuration for the Balancer protocol on Ethereum and Arbitrum networks. Here's a summary:

Part A:
- The Balancer DAO Multisig will grant the role to change gauge weights (5%) to itself by calling `grantRole` on the Authorizer contract.
- It will set the cap of the GOLD/WETH/USDC root gauge to 5% by interacting with the AuthorizerAdaptorEntryPoint and calling `performAction`.
- The Balancer DAO Multisig will revoke the previously assigned role to change gauge weights by calling `revokeRole` on the Authorizer contract.

Part B:
- The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig will add two Arbitrum network gauges (one for each of the 5/25 and 25/25/25/25 pools) to the GaugeAdder4 contract by calling the `addGauge` function.

text:
1. The community has the responsibility to ensure SPs receiving treasury funds are acting in the best interest of the Balancer ecosystem.
2. Any community member can propose stopping funding for an SP, but large veBAL holders have a stronger incentive to ensure SPs deliver value.
3. A delegate system is being created for transparent and productive dialogue between proposers and large voting power holders.
4. Delegates and token holders should not vote in favor of or against funding/defunding an SP they are working for or affiliated with, and SPs should not bribe voters.
5. A new "Abstain" voting option will be added to Snapshot for cases where an SP is affiliated with many large veBAL holders.
6. Risks to the ecosystem include conflicts of interest, SPs not following through on objectives, and unsustainable burn rates from funding multiple SPs.
7. Mitigating these risks involves fostering an active community, declaring conflicts of interest, requesting lower funding amounts or utilizing milestone-based payments as a trial period, and overseeing the Grants Service Provider if milestone-based payments are used.
8. The Ops subDAO will dissolve at the end of the second quarter, returning all powers to veBAL governance.
9. Future funding proposals must adhere to the guidelines described above, and a new tracking system, BIP or Balancer Improvement Proposal, will be implemented.
label: bearish

text:
1. **Lending Market:** Inverse Finance's new lending market is set to release later this year after audits and will utilize ChainLink price oracles. The old lending market has been disabled since June 2022 with no current plans to re-enable.

2. **Audits:** Audit reports can be found at [this link](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1LWNG08mib2GcI1WqnMt5IdFoW73QU2F8/view?usp=sharing) and an audit of relevant legacy code is in progress. The DAO also has a dedicated Risk Working Group overseeing security practices, more information can be found [here](https://www.inverse.finance/blog/posts/en-US/Introducing%20the%20Inverse%20Finance%20Risk%20Working%20Group).

3. **Centralization vectors:** The protocol has certain centralized components, such as Multisig wallets for various working groups (Treasury Working Group, Risk Working Group, Policy Committee, and Fed Chair) that have limited allowances to carry out specific tasks. However, all privileges can be reclaimed/disabled by INV token controlled governance. DOLA stablecoin is fully decentralized with no possibility to pause or blacklist addresses.

4. **Market History:** DOLA stablecoin was launched in February 2021 and has shown resilience in maintaining its USD peg even during times of extreme stress. The DOLA-3Pool experienced bank runs twice, on April 2nd and June 16th, causing brief depegging events.

5. **Value:** This pool is intended to be the primary source of liquidity for INV on decentralized exchanges.

6. **Expected Value Add to Balancer:** The pool can generate consistent fees as it serves as the primary source of liquidity for INV on decentralized exchanges. [Direct link to the pool](https://app.balancer.finance/#/pools/0x8312b4f6e75c9a9d7b046b63fa26280f96804abf) and [gauge link](https://app.balancer.finance/#/governance/gauges).
label: bearish

text:
The text discusses a problem with Uniswap's governance system on the Arbitrum network. Due to a misconfiguration caused by miscommunication between developers, the Uniswap Factory on Arbitrum was deployed with an incorrect owner address that cannot be controlled. This has resulted in nobody being able to execute governance proposals on Arbitrum at present.

Arbitrum proposes a solution involving a temporary exception to disable address-aliasing for messages from the L1 TimeLock contract, followed by a cross-chain message from the L1 Timelock contract to set the owner of the L2 Uniswap factory to the correct alias. Once this is completed and aliasing is re-enabled, cross-chain governance between Uniswap and Arbitrum will be functional again. The success of this proposal could strengthen the relationship between the two projects on Arbitrum.
label: bullish

text:
Title: Temporary Reduction of DAI and sDAI LTV to 0% on All Chains and Alignment of LTs Across Different Chains

   Summary: This proposal suggests a temporary reduction in the LTV of DAI and sDAI to 0% across all chains due to MakerDAO's allocation of a significant portion of potential DAI backing to a new, riskier asset. The proposal also aims to align the LTs and LTVs across different chains.

   Key Points:
   - Decrease DAI and sDAI LTV to 0% temporarily.
   - Gradual decrease in LT by 1 percentage point for every 50M in D3M exposure, with a maximum reduction of 12 percentage points.
   - Standardization of LTs and LTVs across different chains to minimize the impact of LT reductions on the likelihood of liquidations.
   - The proposal prioritizes a risk-averse strategy considering minimal revenues generated from collateral usage.

   Specification: Provides a detailed table showing the current expected LTV and LT for each chain, and the recommended LTV and LT (first and last stage) based on the proposed changes.

   Next Steps:
   1. Gather community feedback and consensus on the proposed changes.
   2. Proceed to ARFC snapshot stage for formal community sentiment check.
   3. If successful, escalate to the AIP (Aave Improvement Proposal) stage for implementation.

   Disclaimer: This proposal is made independently by the ACI.

   Copyright: Copyright and related rights waived via CC0.
label: bearish

The platform is currently used by over 900 DAOs and has raised significant funding from various investors. The transition process involves importing the Aave forum data into Commonwealth and integrating it with the AaveGovernance V2 contracts and Snapshot. The text also mentions upcoming features such as notifications, moderation functionality, API integration, and an app store for DAO tools.

text: The text presents a proposal for Balancer's DAO to implement a standardized protocol revenue sharing model for all liquidity pool creators. The goal is to incentivize developers building innovative solutions on Balancer and minimize governance overhead. The proposed model would be permissionless, allowing any type of pool to divert a share of its protocol fees to the pool's owner or another dedicated address. This is intended to align the interests of the Balancer community with ecosystem partners and encourage growth within the ecosystem. Potential drawbacks include anyone being able to be a "partner" and liquidity fragmentation, but benefits include aligning incentives between the protocol and its partners, offsetting pool creation gas costs, and incentivizing new markets on Balancer. Future improvements may involve veBAL staking/voting for deciding the amount of the rev share and maintaining a blocklist of pool factories for which revenue sharing should be disabled.
label: bearish

The Emergency subDAO will be a 4-of-7 multisig, and it will only have the power to kill gauges in this case. The proposal also includes an additional power for the Emergency subDAO to add tokens to a deny list on the ProtocolFeesWithdrawer contract if necessary. The sentiment of the text is one of concern regarding unfair distribution of funds and the need for swift action to rectify the issue.

text:
1. Social media channels security for Discord, Twitter, Slack, Telegram: Implement and follow best practices for security handling on these platforms. This includes monitoring for phishing/scamming campaigns targeted at Balancer and addressing community reports of such activities.

2. Phishing/Scamming and brand reputation: Detect and respond to phishing and scamming campaigns aimed at Balancer, both with and without external vendors. This also involves managing reporting to block explorers and phishing sites, creating warning channels for the community, engaging relevant vendors for the DAO, and helping protect private DAO/Governance members' personal wallets and computers from such campaigns.

3. Monitor protocol contracts, multi sigs, and detect chain-wide phishing and scamming campaigns: Suggest criteria and requirements for a real-time security monitoring and incident response packages from external vendors.

4. Publicize Balancer's commitment to security: Share information about the measures taken by Balancer for OpSec, InfoSec, and chain security with the community in a sensitive manner.

5. About Hypernative: A cybersecurity firm that actively detects and responds to zero-day attacks, financial risks, on-chain anomalies, and safeguards digital assets, protocols, and Web3 applications. They have experience from companies like Microsoft, IBM, Google, VMware, CyberArk, ChainReaction, Orbs, Intel, and others. Hypernative has assisted several leading crypto organizations such as Polygon, Starknet, Zetachain, Circle, Galaxy, OlympusDAO, Karpatkey DAO, Chainalysis, etc.

The engagement with Hypernative will last for an initial period of 3 months at a cost of $15,000 USDC. After the initial period, $30,000 USDC will be allocated for ongoing work on an hourly basis. Payments will be made to the address: 0x5CA24e2A586834A7B96216D68b26A82405e3DC15. The SLA (Service Level Agreement) will be provided upon acceptance of this proposal.

text:
The text proposes a revision to the tokenomics of the Venus Protocol to optimize income distribution, focusing on a more equitable split between rewards and treasury reserves. Key changes include:
- Increasing protocol reserve revenue allocation to 40% Risk Fund, 40% Treasury Reserve, 10% XVS Vault Rewards (Buyback), and 10% Venus Prime Token Program
- Adjusting liquidation and product development distribution to 50% Risk Fund, 40% Treasury Reserves, and 10% XVS Vault Rewards (Buyback)
- Doubling XVS vault legacy rewards from 525 XVS/Day to 1050 XVS/Day
- Adjusting Venus Prime program rewards from 20% of accumulated product revenues to 10%
- The changes aim to increase treasury reserves, maintain sustainable reward emission rates, and sustain attractive APYs for XVS Vault stakers. The proposal is based on an analysis of the existing tokenomics, past changes, and market trends. The estimated savings from two rounds of 50% XVS emissions reduction will be used to enhance rewards without affecting the token emission rate. The proposed revisions are expected to benefit the Venus ecosystem by ensuring a fairer income distribution and enhancing platform sustainability.
label: bullish

text: The text presents a proposal to list BTC.b as a collateral asset on the Avalanche V3 Market. The Avalanche Bridge is seen as an essential piece of infrastructure for the Avalanche community, providing a secure, cost-effective, fast, transparent, and intuitive bridge between Bitcoin and DeFi. BTC.b, the bridged version of native Bitcoin, is already integrated into multiple DeFi protocols within the Avalanche ecosystem. The proposal suggests that BTC.b could be a good asset to borrow or use as collateral due to its ease of use and integration with various DeFi platforms. The text also provides details about the Avalanche blockchain, its components, and its history, as well as technical specifications of the bridge and BTC.b.

text: The text presents a concern about the current governance process in Balancer, where the Governance Council acts as gatekeepers and has control over what proposals move to a vote. The author suggests that "soft consensus in the community" should not be a factor when considering a proposal for a vote, to avoid situations where large token holders support a proposal but the active community does not. The proposed solution is to change the criteria for a "well defined" proposal, and implement a required minimum quorum of 100k BAL for any snapshot vote to be valid. If the Governance Council fails to execute their duties in good faith, a proposal to replace them with a different mechanism should be made.
label: bullish

The text explains that these adjustments aim to maintain overall risk tolerance while making risk trade-offs between specific assets. It also mentions potential liquidation risks associated with lowering the collateral factor of BNB and provides supporting data on top borrowers and borrow usage. The ABI-encoded calldata for the provided transaction data is:

   `0xddf252ad1be2c89b69c2b068fc378daa952ba7f163c4a11628f55a4df523b3ef`

This can be reproduced by running the provided Hardhat script, which computes the roles and encodes the calldata for the `grantRoles` function call. text: This text outlines a three-step governance process for modifying the roadmap development and definition: Temperature Check, Consensus Check, and Governance Proposal. The Temperature Check determines if there's enough support to change the status quo through a majority vote with a 50k CAKE threshold. If no change is suggested, the topic is closed. If it is, proceed to the Consensus Check. This stage incorporates feedback from the Temperature Check and establishes formal discussion around a potential proposal, requiring another off-chain vote with a 100k CAKE yes-vote threshold. The final step is the Governance Proposal, which should incorporate feedback from the Consensus Check, includes executable on-chain code, requires a delegate with at least 2m CAKE to submit, and has a voting period of 7 days with a 40m CAKE yes-vote threshold. Threshold values may vary over time depending on Circulating Supply.

text:
Title: Chaos Labs' Request for Additional Funding for Continued Services to Aave

Summary: This proposal requests an additional $400K for the remainder of Chaos Labs' current engagement, bringing the total annual compensation to $1.5M. If approved, a stream of 400,000 aUSDT will be created and scheduled to conclude on November 7th, 2023.

Methodologies: Chaos Labs' Research, Chaos Labs - LSD Methodology Update

Specification: The AIP will call the `createStream()` method of the `IAaveEcosystemReserveController` interface to create a stream of 400,000 aUSDT.

Disclaimer: Chaos Labs provides ongoing risk management services to several other borrowing/lending protocols, but their responsibilities concerning Aave are not affected by these commitments. This proposal was not commissioned or paid for by any third party.

Next steps: If consensus is reached, submit an Aave Improvement Proposal (AIP).

Copyright: Copyright and related rights waived via CC0.

text:
1. **Governance Structure**: Both Inverse Finance and Prisma are governed by Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs) controlled by token holders through governance. For Inverse Finance, this is done with INV tokens, while for Prisma, the specific token used for governance isn't explicitly mentioned in the provided information.

   - **Inverse Finance**: The DAO is responsible for governing the Fed contracts that control DOLA supply and demand. A detailed description of the governance can be found [here](https://www.inverse.finance/blog/posts/en-US/all-about-governance-at-inverse-finance). The transparency portal provides a visual representation of Inverse Finance Governance [here](https://www.inverse.finance/transparency/overview).

   - **Prisma**: While Prisma is fully on-chain, it retains minimal admin functions operated via governance. These functions include modifying fees, adding or removing collateral, pausing or unpausing protocol functionality, transferring protocol fees, and adjusting the quorum on admin votes.

2. **Oracles**: Both Inverse Finance and Prisma use Chainlink price feeds for their respective markets. Inverse Finance also utilizes Curve EMA price feeds in some implementations of its FiRM money market. Prisma additionally uses a custom Frax oracle, similar to the one used by crvUSD.

3. **Audits**: Both protocols have undergone multiple audits and bug contests. The audit reports for Inverse Finance can be found [here](https://www.inverse.finance/audits). Prisma has completed three audits from Nomoi, MixBytes, and Zellic, which can be viewed [here](https://github.com/prisma-fi/audits). More information regarding security at Inverse Finance can be found on the [risk docs here](https://docs.inverse.finance/inverse-finance/technical/audits).

4. **Centralization Vectors**: The governance process in both protocols relies on token holders, reducing potential centralization vectors compared to projects managed by a single developer or bot-managed updates. However, the liquidation process could be considered a centralization vector as it's not explicitly clear if this is governed by the DAO or carried out automatically by the protocol. It would be beneficial to confirm whether these processes are indeed under governance control.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a recommendation from Gauntlet to adjust parameters on Aave V3 on various chains (Avalanche, Arbitrum, Polygon, Optimism) due to the recent drop in MAI/MIMATIC price and its failure to maintain peg for months. To incentivize repayment, they propose reducing Liquidation Thresholds (LT) and increasing borrow rates. Specifically, they suggest a conservative or aggressive LT reduction on each chain, along with adjustments to Uopt, Slope2, and RF values. The proposed changes aim to increase borrow rates significantly on all chains. The reader is advised that Gauntlet reserves the right to reconsider these recommendations if market conditions change significantly.

text: This proposal aims to adjust risk parameters across three Aave V2 assets, aligning with a chosen moderate risk level. The changes include lowering liquidation threshold for CRV and other adjustments. These updates are intended to maintain overall risk tolerance while making specific asset trade-offs. Gauntlet's simulation engine uses diverse data inputs to optimize insolvencies, liquidations, and borrow usage. For more details, refer to Gauntlet's Parameter Recommendation Methodology and Model Methodology. The community is encouraged to use the Aave V2 Risk Dashboard for better understanding of the updated parameter suggestions and general market risk in Aave V2. The proposal is targeting an AIP on 2022-08-23.
