text:
In the given code snippets, two transactions are being described for different smart contracts: StablePools and MetaStablePools.

For StablePools, the Gnosis Safe at `0x10A19e7eE7d7F8a52822f6817de8ea18204F2e4f` is sending a transaction to the Vault Authorizer at `0xA331D84eC860Bf466b4CdCcFb4aC09a1B43F3aE6`. The data being sent is an authorization for the GAUNTLET_SAFE at `0xf4A80929163C5179Ca042E1B292F5EFBBE3D89e6` to set the amplification factor on StablePools. The authorization is granted for two roles:

- `0x8c9b4c1f53b968f62f656d48126bd856c38b0d879974dff5b5d6055c0d2917d4` (startAmplificationParameterUpdate)
- `0xc787be37f98a254065bf8678258de57ce53a2d6814c519063f3003dd9f92dfc3` (stopAmplificationParameterUpdate)

For MetaStablePools, the GAUNTLET_SAFE at `0xf4A80929163C5179Ca042E1B292F5EFBBE3D89e6` is sending a transaction to the Vault Authorizer at an unspecified address (presumably the same as for StablePools). The data being sent is an authorization for the GAUNTLET_SAFE to set the amplification factor on MetaStablePools. The authorization is granted for two roles:

- `0xc108e87eca9f3a0e9a9db0b708e6b15a70c3d0859b02723a7cc4b5ca1fb9fc28` (startAmplificationParameterUpdate)
- `0x2f17310a7a479b437515eb1917c45a5f8d1fc7035462cfc7c7c43825dec621b5` (stopAmplificationParameterUpdate)

In both cases, the roles can be reproduced using pseudo-code that calls the appropriate methods on the pool contract to get the sighash for starting and stopping the amplification parameter update.
label: bearish

text:
1. Governance: The SORA governance system uses on-chain voting with XOR tokens, similar to Kusama and Polkadot. Future plans involve the implementation of the SORA Parliament, which will use random sortition for decision making. [Sora Governance](https://sora-xor.medium.com/the-sora-parliament-af8184dae384)

2. Oracles: The protocol uses in-house developed oracles called SORAcles, which will be completed by May 2022. [SORA Oracles Proposal](https://github.com/sora-xor/rfps/pull/33/commits/f2adb81f182d6dd05222c4b8b95b5b34d264b37b)

3. Audits: The protocol was audited by Nettitute on February 20th, 2022. [Nettitude audit Polkaswap XSTUSD](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1wIuFgjdu_w-wfx-bd3kg60C1zJcoUtMt5zJJT8Q_g9s/edit?usp=sharing)

4. Centralization vectors: XSTUSD gets its price data from the XOR-DAI price, so it doesn't require any human updates.

5. Market History: XSTUSD has been active since October 2021 with a TVL of $1.4 Million and an increasing quality of peg. [Curve pool](https://curve.fi/factory/68)
label: bullish

text:
This text discusses a proposal to deploy Uniswap V3 on the Celo blockchain, with a focus on creating green asset pools and increasing the allocation of stablecoins in the Celo Reserve. The Celo Foundation will commit $10M of CELO for user incentives and grants on Celo, with one-third placed in a multisig as a good faith deposit.

The project aims to promote the development of a mobile-first ecosystem, make Uniswap more accessible, especially in underserved markets, and support projects launching and growing "green assets." The deployment will be facilitated by cLabs and governed by Optics messaging bridge.

Key success metrics include allocating 40% of the Celo Reserve to green assets, achieving a TVL of green assets that is 10x the current Celo Reserve holdings, and avoiding or removing 17M tons of CO2 from the atmosphere. The project aims to make a significant impact on climate change and regenerative finance on Celo, aligning with the Uniswap community's vision.

The text concludes by inviting questions and suggestions and provides links to temperature check discussions and snapshots for community feedback.

text:
The text proposes a revision to the tokenomics of the Venus Protocol to optimize income distribution, focusing on a more equitable split between rewards and treasury reserves. Key changes include:
- Increasing protocol reserve revenue allocation to 40% Risk Fund, 40% Treasury Reserve, 10% XVS Vault Rewards (Buyback), and 10% Venus Prime Token Program
- Adjusting liquidation and product development distribution to 50% Risk Fund, 40% Treasury Reserves, and 10% XVS Vault Rewards (Buyback)
- Doubling XVS vault legacy rewards from 525 XVS/Day to 1050 XVS/Day
- Adjusting Venus Prime program rewards from 20% of accumulated product revenues to 10%
- The changes aim to increase treasury reserves, maintain sustainable reward emission rates, and sustain attractive APYs for XVS Vault stakers. The proposal is based on an analysis of the existing tokenomics, past changes, and market trends. The estimated savings from two rounds of 50% XVS emissions reduction will be used to enhance rewards without affecting the token emission rate. The proposed revisions are expected to benefit the Venus ecosystem by ensuring a fairer income distribution and enhancing platform sustainability.
label: bullish

text:
The case study presented here compares the performance of the Balancer Automated Market Maker (BAL) pool on Multichain and hypothetically on Across, a cross-chain liquidity protocol.

In the Multichain BAL pool, there were 34 transfers over a period of 53 days, with 14 withdrawals. The sizes of the 6 largest withdrawals ranged from 12,323 to 1,339 BAL, and the other 8 were less than 1,000 BAL. The pool is now effectively shut down due to low liquidity (only 484 BAL available).

If Balancer were using Across, all 14 withdrawals would have been completed without issue, and the relayer would have been rebalanced within 2-4 hours, ready for more transfers. For 12 of the 14 transfers, users would have received their BAL on Ethereum in 1-4 minutes. For the two largest transfers, it would have taken 2-4 hours. Over the 53 days, the Across LP would have been replenished approximately 7 times, allowing for significantly higher volumes of transactions compared to Multichain.

The Balancer treasury currently holds 80k BAL in Multichain. If they switched to Across, the treasury could take back 40,000 tokens, support over five times the volume at a fraction of the cost, and maintain operational status. The fees on Across are approximately 0.12%, compared to a 12% fee (100x more) on Multichain for moving 100 BAL from Ethereum to Multichain. If Balancer treasury wanted Across to have a fee of 0.10% or lower, they could specify a lower LP fee.

Across has three fees: the LP Fee (configurable via a rate model), the Relayer Fee, and the Destination Gas Fee. The total Across fee mentioned earlier is approximately 0.12%, which is the sum of the LP Fee and the Relayer Fee. This number will be higher when going to Ethereum due to gas costs that scale up quickly as a percentage of the transfer amount for smaller transfers.
label: bearish

text:
1. Tiered Bribe Deployment: To qualify for a Reactor vote in CoRE, 12 million votes are required. The current cost for one TOKE via bribing is ~$0.75, and LUNA has deployed only $257K worth of bribes so far. This proposal suggests sending out tiered bribe amounts starting at $0.35/TOKE and scaling up to $1/TOKE using $2MM of BAL for bribing.

2. Reactor Farming + Potential Token Swap + Business Development Efforts: Securing the BAL reactor and token swap with Tokemak would lead to a net gain in all scenarios plus additional TVL captured. This proposal includes engaging in a token swap with Tokemak to seed the initial reactor, developing default 80/20 pools for deployment on each reactor, exploring veBAL program as an alternative to veCRV on Toke/WETH, discussing boosted pools and stable pools as options for exchange assets to increase capital efficiency, and using the Balancer reactor as a means to acquire TOKE for Balancer.

3. Targeted veBAL Education: An educational campaign will be run to dissuade Hidden Hand users from instantly dumping the BAL. This could include an AMA with Tokemak/Redacted communities and targeted Twitter threads.

Risks associated with this plan include bribe insufficiency, smart contract risk, and potential exploits. However, these risks are mitigated by the current market conditions, previous audits of both projects, and insurance coverage via InsurAce.
label: bearish

text:
The summary is about the integration of Aave's V3 on Ethereum with multi-chain deployments like Hashflow and Wormhole, focusing on the security aspects of these networks.

Wormhole has undergone multiple security audits by companies such as Neodyme, Kudelski, OtterSec, Trail of Bits, and others. It uses a Proof of Authority (PoA) consensus mechanism with 19 guardians, ensuring that more than two-thirds are required to reach consensus and verify a message. These guardians are large and reputable staking providers in the crypto industry.

However, Wormhole has faced an exploit/hack incident in February this year. Since then, it has added multiple security layers to prevent similar incidents, such as Governor, which allows each Guardian to set limits on the notional value of any transfer originating on a supported chain within a specified time period. Other features include the Cosmos-based Wormhole Chain for independent verification of source chain funds and an emergency shutdown module.

Hashflow relies on Market Makers for providing quotes and Wormhole for ensuring cross-chain message accuracy. The security of Hashflow has been audited by Quantstamp, Certik, and OpenZeppelin.

Regarding outages, downtime, or exploits/hacks, there is a mention that Wormhole has faced an incident but has since added multiple layers of security to prevent such occurrences in the future.
label: bearish

text:
The provided text describes a governance proposal on the Goerli testnet, which was successfully executed on both Goerli and Mumbai (Polygon) networks. Here's a summary of the key points:

1. Proposal: A governance proposal with the title "1bp polygon test" was made to the FxRoot contract. The purpose of this proposal was to execute a transaction on the EthereumProxy contract, which in turn would interact with the Uniswap Factory contract on the Polygon network (Mumbai).

2. Targets: The primary target was the Uniswap Factory contract on the Mumbai network, and the secondary target was the FxRoot contract on Goerli.

3. Data: The data sent to the contracts included enabling a fee amount of 100 for the Uniswap Factory contract on Mumbai.

4. Timeline: The temperature check snapshot was from March 3, 2022, to March 6, 2022, and the consensus check snapshot was from March 7, 2022, to March 12, 2022. The governance proposal ETA (Estimated Time of Arrival) was March 28, 2022.

5. Execution: The proposal was executed on both Goerli and Mumbai networks. The execution logs can be found in the provided links for each network.

6. Snapshot Links: The temperature check snapshot link and the consensus check snapshot link were also provided. These snapshots were taken during the specified dates.
label: bullish

text:
This summary outlines two main proposals:

1. **Gelato or Stakewise Initiative**: This is a $10M initiative aimed at promoting the sustainable utilization of Uniswap v3 on Gnosis Chain, which currently lacks a dedicated team for this purpose. The goal is to incentivize liquidity and support the development of new applications using Uniswap v3. The funds will be spent over a 2-year period, with any unused funds returning to the GnosisDAO after the timeframe.

2. **Cross-Chain Governance with Nomad**: To address the fragmented governance across various Uniswap v3 deployments, a partnership has been formed with the Nomad team. Nomad's trust-minimized bridges will be used for cross-chain governance of Uniswap v3 on Gnosis Chain. This is expected to offer a standardized approach to cross-chain governance moving forward.

Additionally, a request for an exemption has been made to allow Gnosis Ltd. to use the Licensed Work to deploy it on Gnosis Chain, subject to Ethereum layer 1 Uniswap Protocol governance and control. The timeline for these proposals includes submission to an on-chain vote following the Consensus Check phase.

The execution of this proposal requires acceptance by both UNI and GNO token holders, as well as the acceptance of the proposal by GnosisDAO. A multi-sig wallet will be set up with four signers, two from the Uniswap community and two from the GnosisDAO community.

The Gnosis Chain is preparing for growth in the coming year, and this initiative is seen as an essential component that will serve as a foundational layer for this growth. The proposals are open to questions and comments, with clarifications provided as needed.
label: neutral

text: This text discusses a proposal to create four new gauges on the mainnet with a 2% cap for baoETH-wsETH, baoETH-rETH, baoUSD-sUSD, and baoUSD-sDAI. The proposal is from Bao Finance, a community-run project that creates onchain tokenized derivatives (synths) and infrastructure. Bao Finance uses Chainlink oracles for collateral prices, has had audits, and aims to improve decentralization using governor bravo in the future. The new gauges will benefit Balancer through trading fees and increased voting incentives for BAL and AURA holders.
label: bearish

text:
The goal is to increase the Total Value Locked (TVL) in each pool to $1M through onboarding new alliance members and engaging community members of all projects and Aurus partners. The total target is to reach $3M TVL over the next 6-12 months.

Governance will be handled via Snapshot for now, with Xave’s own VE governance structure (forked from veBAL) being deployed later. The team's ops 2/3 multisig is currently in control of the TXAU_USDC & TXAG_USDC Polygon FXPools until the community is ready to take ownership of the Xave protocol.

The TXAU_TXAG_WETH pool on Polygon does not use oracles, as it is deployed directly on Balancer v2. The other two pools utilize a Chainlink oracle for FX-accurate swaps within a predetermined range of the bonding curve, with LP ratio determining the price of trades outside this range.

The Aurus Foundation, registered in the UK and regulated by the FCA, facilitates the tokenization of tGOLD ($TXAU) and tSILVER ($TXAG) commodity tokens on behalf of precious metal providers like Gold Refineries. Each token is backed 1:1 with fully allocated LBMA Gold or Silver.

The pools consist of the tGOLD and tSILVER commodity tokens, intended to be the primary source of liquidity for the Aurus ecosystem and subsequent alliance partners. The transactions will be carried out by the Balancer Maxi LM Multisig, interacting with the GaugeAdderv4 and calling the addGauge function with the specified arguments.
label: bearish

text:
- Can anyone provide liquidity to the protocol? Yes
   - Is liquidity incentivized? Partially, Stargate owns a portion of the liquidity within the protocol and incentivizes the remaining liquidity.
   - Is there a fee model for participants? Stargate charges 6 basis points per transfer plus the cost of gas associated with sending the transaction through the LayerZero network.
   - Does the entity is or is planning to provide available liquidity into Aave protocol? Stargate is exploring research ideas around depositing idle liquidity into Aave.
   - Link to analytics dashboard of protocol (Liquidity, assets, networks, volume): https://stargate.finance/overview, https://stgscan.io/
   - Link to user-focused dapp of the entity: https://stargate.finance/
   - Link to technical documentation: https://stargateprotocol.gitbook.io/stargate/

### Credit Line Request
Stargate would like to request credit lines for the blockchains where both it and Aave exist. These are Ethereum, Optimism, Arbitrum, Avalanche, Polygon, and Fantom. They would like to request credit lines there first, with the ability to scale to the other chains as Aave scales Portals.

|Network|Asset|Current Liquidity (USD)|Current 30D volume (USD)|Requested credit Line|Fee Model|Fee requested|
|---|---|---|---|---|---|---|
|All|USDC|90.2M|242M|1M per chain|Fixed|6 bps|
|All|USDT|54.3M|100M|1M per chain|Fixed|6 bps|
|All|ETH|22.7M|68M|1M per chain|Fixed|6 bps|

### Incentives
An incentive program may be approved by the Stargate DAO after the proposal is approved. The Stargate Foundation will recommend that the Stargate DAO give 2 bps of every transaction to the Aave DAO to help align economic incentives and create a deeper partnership between the two communities.

### Audits & Security
- List of relevant security audits of the network: https://github.com/stargate-protocol/stargate/tree/main/audit
- Has the Entity experienced outages, downtime, or exploits/hacks? on which Networks? No
label: neutral

text:
The DeFi Education Fund is a non-profit organization dedicated to supporting Decentralized Autonomous Organizations (DAOs) and the decentralized finance sector. They are currently seeking additional support from Uniswap Governance for three main reasons: long-term funding, unexpected expenses, and expansion of their team.

   If approved, 500k UNI tokens would be transferred to DEF's on-chain wallet, with the remaining 500k locked up in a streaming contract that would "vest" linearly over 12 months. The DEF team will keep Uniswap community members updated through monthly community calls and a thread on the Uniswap governance forum.

   The tokens received from the 2021 proposal were sold according to an 18-month written sales plan, with the last of the UNI tokens being sold in July 2025. The DEF is also open to receiving support from other DAOs and will continue to seek funding from various sources.

text: The text discusses a proposal to deprecate the stable rate mode in Aave v2 and v3 due to a critical bug discovered in November 2023. The bug affected certain assets and led to the halting of new borrowings and rebalancing in the stable rate mode. The current situation is asymmetric, creating technical overhead during security evaluations, and the authors are not comfortable disclosing the attack vector until all user stable debt positions are closed. To address this, they propose making a function that allows any address to swap stable rate to variable, enabling an Aave DAO automation to move all current stable debt positions to variable without penalty. This will facilitate the final deprecation of the stable rate mode once all positions are at variable.
label: bullish

text:
1. Introduction: Cronos is a blockchain platform built using the Cosmos SDK and Tendermint core, with a total value locked (TVL) of $275 million. It supports various cross-chain assets such as CRO, WETH, WBTC, USDC, USDT, DAI, SHIB, DOGE, ATOM, LINK, ENJ, ELON, TUSD, LUNA, DOT, BIFI, VVS, and TONIC.

2. Audience data: Cronos has a significant presence on Twitter (130k followers), Telegram (7k subscribers), and Discord (19,000 members).

3. Links: The provided links lead to the Cronos website, Particle B ecosystem development program, blockchain explorer, Particle B accelerator, Cronos integration documentation, Github repository, and an overview of Cosmos SDK and Tendermint node architecture.

4. Proposed list of initial collaterals: The proposed list of initial collaterals for Aave V3 on Cronos includes CRO, WETH, WBTC, USDC, USDT, DAI, ATOM, LUNA, DOT. Chainlink price feeds are being scheduled for deployment.

5. Incentives: Particle B, the Web3 accelerator of the Cronos chain, has an initial allocation of USD 100 million in CRO tokens for ecosystem development. A portion of these funds will be allocated to end-user incentives for Aave V3 on Cronos, with the exact programs and amounts yet to be refined over time.

6. Audits and security: The Cronos mainnet was launched in November 2021 and has not experienced outages so far. An audit of relevant components of the underlying Ethermint codebase was commissioned by Foris Ltd and completed by Kudelski Security. A bug bounty program is also published, with a bounty of up to 1.3 million dollars.

7. Conclusion: Thank you for your support!
label: bearish

The farm will have 1x CAKE rewards for the first 48 hours, then 0.5x rewards thereafter. The text also provides links to Seedify.fund's official channels and a guide on how to stake CAKE to earn $SFUND rewards. A warning is given about potential scams involving fake $SFUND token contracts.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal to whitelist the COW/ETH pool gauge for veBAL voting, strengthening ties between the COW and BAL communities. The COW Protocol allows users to swap assets at best exchange rates using batch settlement layer on top of popular AMMs and DEX aggregators. Solvers bid for the best possible exchange rate to settle trades, creating CoWs (Coincidence of Wants) to save gas costs, fees, and execution risk. The proposal aims to increase BAL rewards for COW liquidity providers by using COW tokens as a reward for veBAL voters. The text also mentions that the COW Protocol is governed by its token holders, audited, and has potential risks related to centralization and censorship of orders.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses an upgrade of Magpie's Farm rewards liquidity pair from v2 to v3 using MGP-BNB instead of MGP-BUSD. This transition is expected to incentivize the liquidity for MGP token, support healthy trading volumes on PancakeSwap, and be more efficient due to the concentrated liquidity model. The new farm will have doubled emissions for the first 7 days, followed by a daily emission of half the current rate. The team behind Magpie aims to provide yield and veTokenomics boosting services across multiple chains. It is crucial to verify the token address before buying tokens to avoid scams.
label: bearish

text: The Avalanche Foundation has proposed deploying the Aave Protocol into their network, seeking approval from the Aave community. The Avalanche blockchain is scalable, fast, and well-suited for DeFi applications due to its high throughput and near-instant finality. To encourage adoption, the Avalanche Foundation has allocated up to $20M AVAX for users of the Aave protocol as part of their Rush program. The deployment will be subject to a vote by the Aave community, with the goal of fostering growth and synergies between both communities, ultimately strengthening the DeFi ecosystem.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a situation where Platypus Finance, a protocol on Avalanche, was exploited and 9 million in stablecoins were stolen. Some of the stolen funds ended up in Aave V3's Pool contract deployed on Avalanche. This ARC (Aave Improvement Proposal) aims to gather community sentiment for a potential recovery of these funds from the Pool contract. The proposed solution involves deploying a recovery contract, which, if approved by the Aave community through voting, will transfer the exploited funds back to Platypus Finance's multi-sig wallet. The text also provides links to analysis and verification documents about the exploit for transparency.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses a proposal to replenish the BAL for Gas budget on Balancer's platform, which subsidizes Ethereum network gas costs for traders on the Balancer Exchange. The proposal aims to add 50,000 BAL from the Ecosystem Fund due to the current budget nearing exhaustion. The motivation behind this is to make the protocol more accessible to a wider user base amidst increased demand and high transaction costs on Ethereum, while also distributing Balancer governance power to traders. The campaign has already distributed 43,019 BAL tokens to 20,749 unique addresses since its launch, with a significant number of recipients not holding any BAL prior to the program's start. The text suggests that visibility and distribution numbers are expected to grow in the coming weeks. Overall, the sentiment appears to be positive regarding the proposal's potential impact on making the platform more accessible and inclusive for traders.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses the benefits of deploying Uniswap v3 on new and growing networks like Arbitrum and Matic. It highlights potential growth in liquidity, fees, and projects built on Uniswap v3, as well as the expansion of its public smart contract libraries. The author advocates for a quick discussion and action to deploy Uniswap v3 on the Arbitrum network, which is set to launch later this week.
label: bearish

text: The text expresses deep concern and desperation as a father is struggling to raise funds for his daughter's life-saving heart surgery. The sentiment is hopeful, resilient, and pleading for help due to the critical condition of the child. The author loves his daughter dearly and is doing everything possible to save her life.

text:
The text discusses a proposal by LayerZero for integration with the Venus protocol in three phases:

1. Adoption of LayerZero's OFT standard for Venus' stablecoin VAI and governance token XVS, enabling seamless cross-chain token movement and wider distribution.
2. Integration of a cross-chain governance module powered by LayerZero, allowing the Venus DAO to aggregate votes from multiple chains and execute decisions efficiently.
3. Realization of an omnichain money market vision, allowing users to borrow against collateral located on other chains, further enhancing Venus' innovative status in DeFi.

The sentiment is generally positive, indicating excitement about the potential benefits and opportunities that this integration could bring to both LayerZero and the Venus protocol.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a new yield retention model for ibBTC, where partner token harvests are used to support yield and a portion of the yield is distributed back to eligible vault depositors. This results in an increase in gross base yield for all depositors. Performance fees are collected entirely in vault tokens, with the autocompounded yield for depositors being variable. Depositors have the potential to earn more than what is collected for performance fees, potentially making them fee-negative.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses a proposal to allocate Balancer's native token BAL and Polygon's MATIC for incentivizing liquidity on the Polygon network. The motivation behind this move is the strong user adoption and success of DeFi projects on Polygon, particularly Sushi, and the unique advantage that Balancer's flexible AMM offers on this platform. The Ballers plan to focus on multi-asset pools with higher fees and potential partnerships with native Polygon projects. If approved, the BAL + MATIC rewards would start immediately, lasting for 8 weeks, after which the allocation can be adjusted at the discretion of the Ballers. The proposal aims to generate more fees per BAL spent on Polygon than on Ethereum mainnet.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses a proposal (AIP 251) aimed at creating comprehensive, easy-to-understand instructional materials for new members of the ApeCoin DAO. This initiative aims to provide a central resource to help new members navigate the DAO more effectively, ultimately benefiting the entire organization. The cost of implementation is $10,000 in APE at the time of funding.

text:
1. The Rainbow Bridge is a trustless cross-chain asset transfer protocol that utilizes light clients of both networks (Ethereum and NEAR) to verify transactions. It leverages the security of both chains through Provers on each chain, and the bridge assumes that at no time, 2/3 of the validators stake are honest on the NEAR network.

2. The Rainbow Bridge has been audited by ConsenSys and SigmaPrime, with no critical vector attacks identified.

3. An Additional Use Grant is being requested to allow Proximity Labs and Aurora to use the Rainbow Bridge code to deploy it on Aurora, a Layer2 EVM compatible blockchain, subject to Ethereum layer 1 Uniswap Protocol governance and control. The deployment is expected to take around 4-5 weeks, with steps including developing a general message connector on top of the Rainbow Bridge and deploying Uniswap V3 smart contracts on Aurora.

text: The text introduces a proposal for reimbursing gas fees to recognized delegates who vote on Aave's on-chain governance. This is aimed at reducing the cost of participation, encouraging active engagement, fostering diversity, and retaining top delegates. text: The text proposes introducing govFactor, an on-chain voting incentive for Balancer Liquidity Providers to encourage active participation in governance. If passed, it will be implemented as a 3-month trial with voter participation acting as the key success metric. The motivation behind this is to align LPs' interests with the protocol by giving them an incentive to vote, improving overall governance participation. The govFactor multiplies BAL rewards for those who voted on the last proposal and normalizes all amounts so that the total remains the same. It operates as an "on/off" switch, affecting liquidity mining allocations. If all LPs vote, rewards remain the same. Some potential drawbacks are discussed, including non-engaged voting, opsec concerns, varying cadence of governance proposals, and the current idle state of Balancer Governance.
label: bullish

text: The text presents a proposal to adjust parameters in Aave V3 and v2 Ethereum deployments. The changes are subject to market conditions and will be implemented after the unfreeze/unpause of v2 and v3 markets following a security incident. Gauntlet's terms of service apply to any services provided in this context.

text: The text presents a proposal from SymmetricDAO, a Balancer fork currently on Gnosis Chain and Celo, seeking to establish a friendly relationship with the BalancerDAO. SymmetricDAO offers 20,000 SYMM (6.9% of circulating supply) and proposes to send 10,000 BAL for liquidity pools on both platforms. In return, they seek a strategic grant of $100K USDC for further development and marketing. The proposal aims to make Symmetric the first official friendly fork on Celo and Gnosis Chain, with a commitment to support the development of the Balancer Protocol and subsequent friendly forks. Both parties agree to share knowledge, collaborate on technical roadmaps, and engage in co-marketing activities. The agreement is effective immediately but can be terminated with a one-month notice period by either DAO.

text: The text discusses Gauntlet's recommendations to optimize risk and capital efficiency for the Venus protocol. Recommendations include reducing the BNB Collateral Factor from 80% to 75%, increasing borrow caps for BCH from 4,331 to 7,000, and increasing borrow caps for FIL from 122,200 to 180,000. The text explains that these adjustments aim to maintain overall risk tolerance while making risk trade-offs between specific assets. It also mentions potential liquidation risks associated with lowering the collateral factor of BNB and provides supporting data on top borrowers and borrow usage. The text encourages the community to view Gauntlet's Venus Risk Dashboard for a better understanding of the updated parameter suggestions and general market risk in Venus. Overall, the sentiment is informative and focused on risk management and optimization.
label: bullish

text:
The text proposes a revision to the tokenomics of the Venus Protocol to optimize income distribution, focusing on a more equitable split between rewards and treasury reserves. Key changes include:
- Increasing protocol reserve revenue allocation to 40% Risk Fund, 40% Treasury Reserve, 10% XVS Vault Rewards (Buyback), and 10% Venus Prime Token Program
- Adjusting liquidation and product development distribution to 50% Risk Fund, 40% Treasury Reserves, and 10% XVS Vault Rewards (Buyback)
- Doubling XVS vault legacy rewards from 525 XVS/Day to 1050 XVS/Day
- Adjusting Venus Prime program rewards from 20% of accumulated product revenues to 10%
- The changes aim to increase treasury reserves, maintain sustainable reward emission rates, and sustain attractive APYs for XVS Vault stakers. The proposal is based on an analysis of the existing tokenomics, past changes, and market trends. The estimated savings from two rounds of 50% XVS emissions reduction will be used to enhance rewards without affecting the token emission rate. The proposed revisions are expected to benefit the Venus ecosystem by ensuring a fairer income distribution and enhancing platform sustainability.
label: bullish

text: The text presents an opportunity for Aave governance to onboard AgEUR, a decentralized EUR-pegged stablecoin, onto Aave Optimism V3 as a non-collateral asset. It also mentions various risk parameters for AgEUR on Aave Optimism V3, inviting feedback from Risk Service Providers. The text clarifies that the Aave-Chan Initiative (ACI) is not associated with or compensated by Angle to publish this ARFC and that Marc Zeller, the founder of ACI, does not possess any ANGLE or hold a significant amount of agEUR at the time of writing. The text ends with a copyright disclaimer. Overall sentiment: Neutral/Informative.

text: The text presents a proposal to add a gauge for MAI/USDC on Ethereum. MAI is described as a decentralized stablecoin overcollateralized by various assets, currently the top external use case for BAL on Polygon. text:
This script is using the Hardhat framework for Ethereum development and it performs the following actions:

1. It defines two interfaces for smart contracts, one for a stable pool (`stable_pool`) and another for a linear pool (`linear_pool`). These interfaces are used to interact with specific functions of these contracts.

2. It also defines three addresses: `GAUNTLET_FEE_SETTER`, `GAUNTLET_AMP_SETTER`, and `BALLERS_MULTISIG`. These addresses represent accounts that have certain roles in the system.

3. It defines two more addresses, `AAVE_LINEAR_FACTORY` and `STABLE_PHANTOM_FACTORY`, which are factories for creating linear pools on the Aave and Phantom protocols respectively.

4. The script then creates roles for each function that can be granted to the specified accounts using the `authorizer` contract. It does this by calling the `grantRoles` function of the `authorizer` contract, passing in an array of role IDs (which are created using the `roleId` function) and the address of the account that should receive these roles.

   - In step 1, it grants the `setSwapFeePercentage` role to the `GAUNTLET_FEE_SETTER` for the stable pool.
   - In step 2, it grants the `startAmplificationParameterUpdate` and `stopAmplificationParameterUpdate` roles to the `GAUNTLET_AMP_SETTER` for the stable pool.
   - In step 3, it grants multiple roles (`setTokenRateCacheDuration`, `setTargets`, and `setSwapFeePercentage`) to the `BALLERS_MULTISIG` account for both the Aave linear pool and the Phantom stable pool factories.

   The script then logs the data that would be sent to the `authorizer` contract if these transactions were to be executed on the Ethereum network.
label: bullish

Title: Proposal for Innovative Safety Module (Code A) in Aave V3

Description: This proposal outlines a new project aimed at improving the Aave Safety Module, named Code A. The project will significantly alter the dynamics of the Safety Module and its components, including stkGHO, stkAAVE, and stkABPT. It will offer more efficient mechanisms, improved user experience, better dynamics for builders to build upon, and have a substantial impact on AAVE tokenomics. The project is holistically designed, taking into account Aave v3 and GHO, and will directly/indirectly benefit any future project of the DAO.

Duration: Approximately 6 months for completion, with iterative delivery and communication over the course of the project.

Budget: 1'900'000 in stablecoins and 7'500 AAVE, with a payment schedule of 40% upfront and 60% in a delayed payment after 4 months.

Terms of Service:
- The intellectual property and licensing of the major projects belong to the Aave DAO.
- BGD Labs does not decide what gets activated/applied in Aave; it is always up to the DAO governance to decide if the software should be enabled in production.
- While no software is flawless, BGD Labs pursues solid security standards and procedures to minimize any potential impact.

Next Steps: If this proposal receives a positive response, an on-chain governance proposal will be submitted for formal agreement between the Aave DAO and BGD Labs, based on the terms defined in this document.

text:
In the given scenario, the `stakingBoost` is calculated to increase the adjusted liquidity in a desired amount ($90M in this case) by stretching or shrinking the temporary `tempStakingBoost`. The calculation involves comparing the ratio of the final liquidity adjustment (desired - pre-staking liquidity) to the temporary liquidity adjustment (temporary - pre-staking liquidity), and setting the stakingBoost equal to the product of this ratio and the temporary stakingBoost.

Shareholder addresses, which include investors, advisors, and founders of Balancer Labs, will be excluded from participating in liquidity staking to accelerate governance rights distribution. The list of these shareholder addresses can be found at [this link](https://github.com/balancer-labs/bal-mining-scripts/blob/liquidity-staking/src/users.ts). It is important to note that the exclusion only applies to their wallets related to their shareholder allocations, not any BAL they hold from other sources such as market purchases or LP rewards.

The community has agreed to tolerate up to about 10k BAL per week per shareholder being sent to centralized exchanges, acknowledging that shareholders may seek to deleverage their BAL positions over time without attempting to subvert the exclusion list. The list may be updated as needed to reflect any changes in shareholder addresses, such as those moving to third-party custody solutions or multisig wallets. The community also has the prerogative to update this list so that changes are effective before any still pending weekly distribution.
label: bullish

text:
1. Contract Interaction:
   - The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig contract at `0xc38c5f97B34E175FFd35407fc91a937300E33860` will interact with the GaugeAdderv4 contract at `0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd`.
   - The Multisig contract will call the addGauge function with each "Root Gauge" as the `gauge(address)` argument.

2. Root Gauges and their network details:
   - rETH/WETH: Network Address: 0xc771c1a5905420daec317b154eb13e4198ba97d0, GaugeType: Base
   - cbETH/WETH: Network Address: 0xfb4c2e6e6e27b5b4a07a36360c89ede29bb3c9b6, GaugeType: Base
   - USDC/USDbC/axlUSDC: Network Address: 0x0c659734f1eef9c63b7ebdf78a164cdd745586db, GaugeType: Base
   - GOLD/WETH/USDC (10%): Network Address: 0x433f09ca08623e48bac7128b7105de678e37d988, GaugeType: Base
   - GOLD/BAL/USDC (2%): Network Address: 0xb328b50f1f7d97ee8ea391ab5096dd7657555f49, GaugeType: Base

3. Gauge Type Explanation:
   - Avalanche: Not specified in the data provided.
   - Base: These gauges are used as a base for other gauges and will be added to the GaugeAdapter contract.

4. Important Note:
   - The first two specifications (rETH/WETH and cbETH/WETH) will properly simulate on Tenderly, but the gauge adds cannot be simulated successfully until the Setting Gauge Factories Specification is executed on Mainnet. This means that the remaining gauges (USDC/USDbC/axlUSDC, GOLD/WETH/USDC, and GOLD/BAL/USDC) will not be added to the GaugeAdapter contract until the Setting Gauge Factories Specification is deployed on Mainnet.

text:
1. Action #1 - "Collect Fees": This action involves collecting fees from various DEXs, including Uniswap, Sushiswap, and Balancer. The collected fees are then converted to USDC.

   - Smart Vaults: Mainnet, Polygon, and Arbitrum
   - Automatic execution: Yes, by Mimic bot when the total value of fees exceeds a certain threshold. Manual execution is also possible by the Manager.
   - Primitives: Includes functions for calling external contract functions (withdrawCollectedFees from ProtocolFeesCollector), swapping tokens at the best rate, and transferring USDC to the Smart Vault.

2. Action #2 - "Gather and convert to BAL": This action gathers BAL and BAL-like assets from the Balancer ProtocolFeesCollector and swaps them to BAL (except for BAL itself).

   - Smart Vaults: Mainnet, Polygon, and Arbitrum.
   - Primitives: Includes functions for calling external contract functions (withdrawCollectedFees from ProtocolFeesCollector), swapping tokens at the best rate, and transferring BAL to the Smart Vault.

3. Action #3 - "Bridge": This action bridges USDC and BAL between different networks, specifically from Polygon and Arbitrum to Mainnet.

   - Smart Vaults: Polygon and Arbitrum.
   - Primitives: Includes a bridge function for transferring assets between layers (in this case, between different blockchains).

4. Action #4 - "Withdraw": This action allows the Manager to withdraw any asset from the Smart Vault to an external wallet configured by the owner.

   - Smart Vaults: Mainnet, Polygon, and Arbitrum.
   - Primitives: Includes a function for transferring assets to an external address.
label: bullish

This document outlines a technical specification for a collaboration between Balancer DAO and Wonderland, involving recurring USDC transfers and token vesting. Here's a summary:

1. **Monthly USDC Transfer:** The Balancer DAO will send 30k USDC to Wonderland every month. This transfer is executed using the `transfer()` function of the USDC contract.

2. **BAL Vesting:** The Balancer DAO will create a 4-year vesting schedule for 275k BAL tokens to be sent to Wonderland using Yearn's Vesting Escrow. This process involves two transactions:
   - Approving the Yearn Vesting Escrow Factory to spend the BAL tokens.
   - Deploying the Vesting Contract using the Yearn Vesting Escrow Factory. The vesting duration is set to 4 years, starting on February 14th, 2024.

3. **BAL Call Option:** A real-world contract for a BAL call option will be drafted by the foundation. No further details are provided in this document.

The Tenderly Simulation link is provided for reference: https://dashboard.tenderly.co/explorer/fork/e8ea44be-0261-4e2b-8a5f-994c023f81b1/transactions

The Syrup Pool will distribute 93,750 EDU over 60 days, with rewards per block at 0.05425 EDU. The maximum staked CAKE per wallet is limited for the first 48 hours, then unlimited. Additionally, three farms on BNB Chain will be provided with varying CAKE rewards. $EDU serves as a governance token, payment method, and for on-chain revenue sharing. Users can learn more about Open Campus through its official channels. Always verify the token address before buying tokens to avoid scams.
label: neutral

text: 0x Labs is seeking community feedback on their proposal for on-chain governance as outlined in ZEIP-95. The process includes three steps: initial calibration, migration, and a vote to switch governance systems. This snapshot vote only gauges sentiment for the first step. If favorable, 0x Labs will continue development and deployment of the new governance mechanism's smart contracts. A subsequent vote will be required to officially complete the transition.
label: bullish

text: The text presents a proposal to hire a Head of Network Development for the APE Foundation, aimed at supporting the strategic goals of the ApeCoin DAO and ensuring operational excellence. This role is crucial for maintaining momentum, building community trust, and ensuring long-term sustainability. The cost of this position will be offset by reducing Special Council members' payments. The proposal emphasizes that this role does not equate to a CEO or leader but rather a critical support function. The text concludes by stating that the APE Foundation has discretionary authority to exceed the proposed budget if deemed necessary for a competitive salary.
label: bearish

text:
This summary outlines the current structure, roles, and compensation of the Aave Grants DAO (AGD), a decentralized autonomous organization responsible for distributing grants to projects within the Aave ecosystem. The AGD team consists of ten members, led by Bill who oversees growth, grant distribution, and strategic needs. The Review Committee, made up of industry experts, evaluates grant applications. Migi serves as the Analyst, managing relationships with grantees and tracking returns, while Neil handles operations and administrative tasks.

The proposal suggests an increase in AGD's GHO allowance by $328,000 over six months, reallocating previously allocated 'Digital Marketing' spend to this budget. The funds will be divided between a Grants Budget and an Operations Budget. The Grants Budget aims to introduce a new $20k max grant size for all grants and focus on growing teams building on Aave and GHO. The Operations Budget, which receives increased funding, covers compensation, maintenance, and legal costs.

The next steps involve gathering community feedback, reaching consensus, escalating the proposal to ARFC snapshot stage, and if approved, moving it to the AIP stage. This TEMP CHECK is powered by Skywards, and no compensation was received from AGD for creating this proposal. The copyright is waived via CC0.
label: bullish

text: The text discusses UMA, a popular and essential asset used in contracts with the UMA Protocol. Currently, it cannot be utilized as collateral on Aave to acquire other assets. The UMA Protocol is a community-led oracle for Web3, enabling price access to various things. It offers products like KPI Options, cross-chain bridges, Range tokens, Success Tokins, and Call/Put Options. A proposal exists to add UMA as an asset on AAVE v2/v3 for users to use as collateral. The current TVL (Total Value Locked) of UMA is $100.3 million. More details about the proposal can be found here: [redacted link].
label: bullish

text: The text discusses a proposal by the ether.fi team to create a Balancer Boosted Gauge for a weETH-rETH pool on Arbitrum, with a 10% emissions cap. This move aims to provide a 100% yield bearing pair within the DeFi ecosystem. The ether.fi protocol is a decentralized, non-custodial liquid staking protocol built on Ethereum that allows users to stake their ETH and participate in DeFi without losing liquidity. The proposal seeks to increase the liquidity of the LRT token on Arbitrum for easier entry/exit of positions, enhancing its usability within the L2 DeFi ecosystem. The proposal is part of ether.fi's strategy to boost liquidity and attractiveness of their LRT token.
label: neutral

text: The text proposes to redistribute CAKE rewards from underperforming farms to high performing ones, thereby increasing rewards for the latter and reducing them for the former. This is based on a performance index that evaluates various metrics such as reward multiplier, daily volume, 30-day volume, unique token holders on BSC, etc. The text provides a list of 35 underperforming farms whose CAKE rewards will be reduced, with the surplus being distributed to other existing farms and potentially new ones.
label: neutral

text: The text discusses a proposal to expand the veCAKE Gauges System to include Polygon zkEVM. This system allows veCAKE holders to influence CAKE emissions distribution and delegate voting rights to external protocols. The addition of Polygon zkEVM is expected to increase daily CAKE emissions allocated to its farms, while the Kitchen will retain a 40% voting share for core pairs on this network. If approved by the community, veCAKE will be launched on Polygon zkEVM shortly. The sentiment appears to be positive and informative, expressing excitement about the expansion of the system.
label: bearish

text: The text suggests a potential collaboration between CAKE and companies listed on the NYSE and NASDAQ, possibly using a system called "RWA." The sentiment is positive and anticipatory.

It offers digital wearables and accessories to Apecoin holders, allowing them to create personal 3D avatars and participate in a Fashion Battle Royale powered by Apecoin. The event aims to showcase the fashion relevance of the Apecoin ecosystem and attract a wider audience through prize money and an IRL fashion event in Paris. The collaboration is expected to inject new energy into the Apecoin ecosystem, promote its IPs, and cost approximately $100,000 USD equivalent in Ape. The proposal can be found at [the Ape forum](https://forum.apecoin.com/). The text suggests a positive sentiment towards the fusion of fashion, culture, and Web3 self-expression within the Apecoin ecosystem.

text: The text proposes an immersive learning platform (HOST) that integrates web2 and web3 technologies. It aims to incentivize high-quality content creation through a governance token and issue SBT certificates for completed courses. The platform's cost structure includes a $50,000 kickstart in ApeCoin for Phase 1, with potential further phases yet to be determined upon Otherside integrations. The proposal is administered by the Ape Foundation, subject to alterations for security and usability. The overall sentiment is optimistic and forward-looking regarding the potential of this educational platform.

text: The text proposes a freeze of the Aave V3 market on the Fantom network due to low traction, dependency on external bridges, and potential risks associated with these bridges. The market generates around $30 daily fees for the protocol but poses a risk of users losing millions due to external security issues. The proposal aims to protect users by disabling deposits and borrowing while allowing repayment, liquidations, withdrawals, and interest rate changes. The focus is suggested to shift towards networks with fewer bridge risks such as Avalanche and Polygon, with L2s (Optimism/Arbitrum) gaining traction.
label: neutral

The motivation includes benefits like passive yield for both communities, significant TVL, and holder count of slisBNB. Proof of liquidity is offered through weekly incentives by Lista DAO. If approved, the proposal will progress through various stages before final confirmation and enforcement. The text is neutral in tone, focusing on the potential benefits of the proposed action.

text: The text describes a 12-month proposal by Chaos Labs to collaborate with Aave on improving risk monitoring and parameter settings for Aave v3 markets, with no initial cost to Aave DAO during development. The scope includes risk management, parameter recommendations, asset listing risk analytics, open-sourced agent access, extending the AAVE v3 Risk Analytics App, and community risk calls. The proposal has received support from several Aave contributors and stakeholders, aiming to progress further.

text: The text discusses a forum discussion about adjusting Reserve Factors for Compound II, presenting three options: decreasing or increasing Reserve Factors for USDT and DAI, or waiting until Compound III is live. Gauntlet recommends option 1 (decrease) and 3 (wait), as option 2 (increase) could potentially lead to decreased revenues due to unknown user elasticity. The decision aims to bring interest rates closer to market rate, gather data on borrower and supplier elasticity, and improve models for future strategies.

text: The text discusses a proposal to lower the liquidation threshold for collateral assets in Aave, a decentralized lending platform, to reduce risk during unfavorable market conditions. This change could potentially affect users with low account health and may lead to "risk-off liquidations" if they fail to monitor their account or provide sufficient collateral on time. The community is asked to vote on the maximum percentage by which each collateral asset's liquidation threshold can be reduced, with options ranging from 0% (no risk management) to 3%. The limit would not apply under severe conditions such as contract vulnerabilities and would affect all supported assets like WETH, WBTC, DAI, etc.
label: bearish

It is backed by protocol owned reserves and has substantial liquidity on Uniswap V2. If listed, it would provide more decentralized stablecoin alternatives for Aave, benefiting both ecosystems. The proposal is only for depositing and lending, not as collateral. FEI has a large community on Twitter and Discord, with early-mid maturity, and is deployed on Ethereum. The proposal follows the steps from Aave governance docs.

The position may be put up for election at the end of this period, or transferred to working groups as decided by the Special Council. The proposal is part of AIP-266, administered by the Ape Foundation, and any material deviations from the initial approved version will be disclosed to the APE holder community.

text: The text proposes a change in the Snapshot strategy for space-based snapshot delegation, aiming to simplify it by using only one layer of delegation instead of two. This is motivated by reasons such as ease of measurement, flexibility for vlAURA holders, and potential use with voting marketplaces. The risk involved is minimal as the new strategy has been tested thoroughly. The current strategy uses three sub-strategies, while the proposed strategy simplifies it by changing the vlAURA parts to map the vlAURA balance directly to the underlying veBAL balance, allowing vlAURA holders more flexibility in their voting power.
label: bearish

text: The text discusses the concept of de-minting in a blockchain platform called Wigo, as an alternative to the traditional burning mechanism for token management. De-minting reduces both the circulating supply and total supply by transferring tokens to a null address while also reducing the total number of tokens. This mechanism is combined with gamification to encourage user activity, potentially leading to a limited economy with negative inflation, making the token rarer and more valuable over time. The text suggests that this model benefits all stakeholders: token holders, users, liquidity providers, and network beneficiaries.

text: The text discusses a proposal to extend the 'govFactor' in the Balancer protocol for V1 liquidity mining. The govFactor was initially tested as a trial to boost voter participation, and it has been successful in increasing tokenholder participation significantly. However, with the transition to Balancer V2, there are no factors implemented in V2 liquidity mining. This proposal aims to determine whether the Balancer protocol should keep the govFactor for V1 liquidity mining indefinitely. The govFactor is a factor that increases the adjusted liquidity of V1 LPs who vote on Snapshot proposals.

text: This text describes a Balancer pool that uses Gearbox's capital provision market to earn additional yield for USDC and DAI tokens. text: The text proposes a four-week pilot starting on January 25th, reimbursing up to 7,500 BAL per week for gas costs incurred during swaps performed through the Balancer Exchange Proxy. This is aimed at improving usability and reducing costs for users of the Balancer v1 exchange, with the new UI, while awaiting the launch of Balancer v2. The reimbursement mechanism will be open-source, auditable, and targeted towards transactions made directly to the Balancer Exchange Proxy, excluding most on-chain arbitrage bots. Eligible swaps are limited to specific tokens, with the gas reimbursement being the lowest of either the total gas used by the transaction or 100,000 times the number of eligible swaps in the transaction. The gas price for reimbursements will be the lowest of either the transaction's gas price or the median price of all transactions within the enclosing block. Reimbursements will be made via a MerkleRedeem contract, and claims would be available weekly. The program is funded by the Balancer Ecosystem Fund and will not affect ongoing liquidity mining or Ecosystem Fund Grants.
label: bullish

text:
This text provides an overview of the current state and future plans for Hardhat, an Ethereum development environment, and Web3.js, a frontend platform for dApps.

Hardhat is a flexible and extensible tool used by developers to compile, deploy, test, and debug Ethereum software. Its roadmap includes creating an integrated development environment (IDE), contract deployment tools, a local development network, and a build/testing workflow. The goal is to empower developers to create their own solutions and share them with the community as plugins.

Hardhat will eventually migrate to using Rethnet and Slang, which are expected to increase its feature richness, speed, and stability.

Web3.js, the original Ethereum connector library, is being revitalized into a high-value project. The goal is to create a hub for community spaces, support spaces, educational resources, extensions, and related projects, with an active ecosystem development effort. This will improve troubleshooting, developer training, code reusability, and the ability to extend the library.

The Nomic Foundation is fundraising across multiple organizations and individuals within the Ethereum ecosystem to support these projects. Uniswap is being approached for a $5M contribution due to its current use of Hardhat in building its protocol. The funds will contribute to maintaining critical infrastructure, increasing developer productivity, accelerating innovation, and growing the market for all Ethereum-based projects, including Uniswap.
label: bearish

text:
The text proposes a revision to the tokenomics of the Venus Protocol to optimize income distribution, focusing on a more equitable split between rewards and treasury reserves. Key changes include:
- Increasing protocol reserve revenue allocation to 40% Risk Fund, 40% Treasury Reserve, 10% XVS Vault Rewards (Buyback), and 10% Venus Prime Token Program
- Adjusting liquidation and product development distribution to 50% Risk Fund, 40% Treasury Reserves, and 10% XVS Vault Rewards (Buyback)
- Doubling XVS vault legacy rewards from 525 XVS/Day to 1050 XVS/Day
- Adjusting Venus Prime program rewards from 20% of accumulated product revenues to 10%
- The changes aim to increase treasury reserves, maintain sustainable reward emission rates, and sustain attractive APYs for XVS Vault stakers. The proposal is based on an analysis of the existing tokenomics, past changes, and market trends. The estimated savings from two rounds of 50% XVS emissions reduction will be used to enhance rewards without affecting the token emission rate. The proposed revisions are expected to benefit the Venus ecosystem by ensuring a fairer income distribution and enhancing platform sustainability.
label: bullish

text:
Here's a summary of the strategies discussed:

1. **Aave Stable Strategy**: Deposit capital into a Curve pool and stake the LP token on Convex to earn stkAAVE, CVX, CRV, and CRV incentive derived yield. The expected yield is around 4.07% vAPY for sAave strategy and 6.19% vAPY for Aave strategy before Aave's CRV and CVX voting influences the CRV incentive derived yield.

2. **ETH Strategy**: Transfer ETH from Aave V1 RF to Aave V2 RF, redeem awETH for ETH, deposit the combined ETH into the Curve stETH pool, stake steCRV in Convex to earn CRV, CVX, and LDO incentives. The expected yield is around 6.65% vAPY.

3. **Balancer Strategy**: Deposit an equal amount of DAI, USDC, and USDT into the Balancer Boosted Pool. Earn swap fee income, Liquidity Mining (LM) incentives, and yield derived from unproductive capital being deposited into Aave V2 to earn yield. The strategy aims to exceed the Stable Pool's yield to attract users. All BAL rewards are to be retained to accumulate governance influence.

Each of these strategies aims to generate yield for investors by leveraging various DeFi protocols and liquidity mining incentives. It is important to note that yields can fluctuate based on market conditions, changes in protocol incentives, and other factors. Always do your own research before investing.
label: bullish

text:
The proposal outlines a framework for evaluating the performance of a team, focusing on hard metrics such as length of engagement (August 1, 2023 through December 31, 2023) and budget.

The budget is divided into two quarters and includes expense categories in USDC by quarter. The team consists of independent contractors, with operational costs kept minimal, containing insurance, software subscriptions, tax/accounting services, and startup expenses for the company. Legal expenses are not included as they will be granted access to legal support from GRC resources.

The team is also requesting 62,230.58 BAL to cover commitments made in previous employment packages. These BAL tokens would be awarded as compensation to current team members on a 4-year vesting basis, with a 1-year cliff, starting from each employee’s initial employment date in the ecosystem.

The budget for BAL includes funds required up front to seed vesting contracts for each individual contributor. The full amount of BAL tokens can be repossessed by the OpCo and returned to the Balancer Treasury upon termination of a contributor’s contract.

The team does not require any net new BAL as the 62,230.58 BAL requested are currently in possession of Orb Collective and will soon be returned to the Treasury. The funding would cost around ~6.8% of the treasury’s USDC, annualizing to ~16%.

The team wishes to be funded via the OpCo's multisig address: 0x3B8910F378034FD6E103Df958863e5c684072693. A Service Level Agreement (SLA) will be entered into with the OpCo in the event that this proposal is accepted, and a link to the agreement will be provided for posterity.
label: neutral

text:
The Gyroscope Protocol, currently in limited production on Polygon, is a decentralized finance (DeFi) protocol that will be governed by a Decentralized Autonomous Organization (DAO) and relevant stakeholders upon its full launch on Ethereum. The protocol features an E-CLP (Ethereum Concentrated Liquidity Pool) for the WMATIC/MATICX pair, which is controlled by Gyroscope governance.

The oracle for WMATIC is currently set to none, while the rateProvider1 for MATICX is managed by an address on Polygon (0xeE652bbF72689AA59F0B8F981c9c90e2A8Af8d8f).

The E-CLP has undergone audits by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification, with the reports available at [this link](https://docs.gyro.finance/gyroscope-protocol/audit-reports). The E-CLP code has been live in production on Polygon since November 2022.

The FTL Labs team's multi-sig can currently pause the pool, change the swap fee, and set the protocol fee. However, no centralization vectors have been identified.

Links to the new pool and gauge for the WMATIC/MATICX E-CLP on Polygon are provided. The Balancer Maxi LM Multisig will interact with the `GaugeAdderv4` at a specific address and call the addGauge function with the specified arguments.
label: bearish

text:
This text is a proposal for the deployment of Uniswap, a decentralized exchange protocol, on Moonbeam, a Polkadot parachain. The proposal involves a grant of $2,500,000 from the Moonbeam Foundation to the Uniswap Grants Program to support the development of multi-chain applications and improve user experiences for Uniswap across different chains.

The goal is to expand Uniswap into the Polkadot ecosystem, leveraging Moonbeam's EVM compatibility and its position as a DeFi hub for Polkadot. The proposal also suggests using Nomad's trust-minimized channels for decentralized governance in the deployment of Uniswap V3 on Moonbeam.

The grant will fund various projects such as building cross-chain applications, improving open-source wallet softwares, creating frontend applications for easier governance proposals, and leveraging Substrate’s native interoperability protocol, XCM, to build composable Uniswap applications across different chains.

The proposal aims to encourage innovation towards making Uniswap a premier AMM (Automated Market Maker) across Polkadot, while also supporting developers working on multi-chain projects that improve, extend, promote or build upon Unsiwap in a cross-chain manner. The authors of this text express their excitement about the potential of this collaboration and invite feedback from the Uniswap community to further refine the proposal.

text:
The 1inch DAO generates revenue primarily in USDC through the Swap Surplus collector. The majority of this surplus is converted to USDC and deposited into the DAO's treasury. The 1INCH token, launched on December 23, 2020, has a high trading volume and a large number of users.

The 1INCH token is an ERC-20 token with governance influence held by around 5,391 wallets (staked INCH token, st1INCH). The 1inch Foundation, which holds the majority of the 1INCH tokens, has transferred out most of its tokens and currently holds approximately $15M.

There have been several audits available on Github for the 1inch smart contract. On April 6th, 2022, the 1inch Foundation burned the mint function of 1INCH.

For listing 1INCH as collateral on Aave v2, Gauntlet's risk parameters include:
- Collateral: Yes
- Borrowing: Yes
- LTV: 40%
- Liquidation Threshold: 50%
- Liquidation Penalty: 8.5%
- Reserve Factor: 20%
- UOptimal: 45%
- R_0: 0%
- R_s1: 7%
- R_s2: 300

For further context on the associated risks for listing 1INCH, please refer to the discussion on the governance forum.
label: bullish

The idea involves CAKE taking a percentage of the tokens it receives, buying UBI tokens, burning them, and then sending the remaining CAKE to a death address and burning it as well. text:
1. Projects: jBRL is associated with the Optimism network (0x40bd131fA9933D592344783E38f0c0F27767d9FA), while Transfero does not have a specified network.
2. Oracles: jBRL uses the BRLUSD Chainlink price feed, whereas BRZ does not have a price feed.
3. Audits: Jarvis has conducted an audit (GitBook link provided), but there is no information about an audit for Transfero.
4. Centralizing vector: jBRL is mainly collateralized by USDC, while BRZ is a fiat-backed stablecoin issued by a centralized entity.
5. Market history: jBRL has been live since February 2022 on the BNB Chain and experienced some deviations from its peg during the FTX crisis due to supply issues. BRZ had issues with its peg because its primary off-chain market was on FTX, and it uses a wrapped BRZ from Solana. Both stablecoins have maintained their peg since the pool launch (on the BNB).
6. Value: The 2brl-bb-am-usd pool will act as the main secondary liquidity source for BRZ and jBRL, producing a higher natural yield for its LP due to its role in arbitrage and other use cases. This move is the first step toward moving the ecosystem to Balancer.
7. Contracts:
   - 2brl Balancer Pool (Polygon): 0xE22483774bd8611bE2Ad2F4194078DaC9159F4bA (AMP 200 because both tokens are redeemable).
   - 2brl-bb-am-usd Balancer pool (Polygon): 0x4A0b73f0D13fF6d43e304a174697e3d5CFd310a4
   - jBRL token (Polygon): 0xf2f77FE7b8e66571E0fca7104c4d670BF1C8d722

text:
1. Gnosis Chain, BSC, Avalanche, Optimism, and Transfero are the supported blockchains for jBRL and BRZ tokens. The respective addresses for each chain are provided.

2. jBRL uses BRLUSD Chainlink price feed while BRZ does not have a price feed.

3. Audits for jBRL were conducted by Jarvis, with the results available at this link: [Jarvis Audit Report](https://app.gitbook.com/o/-MlHWTFf2MofxCAFbR4l/s/-MeLxeE9i1iOeDR_J-tQ/risks-warning/audits). No audit information was provided for Transfero.

4. jBRL is mainly collateralized by USDC, while BRZ is a fiat-backed stablecoin issued by a centralized entity.

5. jBRL has been live since February 2022 on the BNB Chain and experienced issues during the FTX crisis due to supply imbalance. The issue was resolved by withdrawing jBRL from the money market, forcing users to repay their loans by buying jBRL from the Liquidity Pool. BRZ also faced peg issues due to its primary off-chain market being on FTX. Both stablecoins have maintained their peg since the pool launch.

6. The 2brl pool will act as the main route for arbitrages and provide use cases such as on-chain liquidity, credit without FX risks, etc. This is the first step towards moving the ecosystem to Balancer's.

7. Contract details:
   - 2brl Balancer Pool (Polygon): 0xE22483774bd8611bE2Ad2F4194078DaC9159F4bA
   - jBRL token (Polygon): 0xf2f77FE7b8e66571E0fca7104c4d670BF1C8d722
   - jBRL (Polygon Synthereum Liquidity Pool): 0x30e97dc680ee97ff65b5188d34fb4ea20b38d710
   - BRZ token (Polygon): 0xf2f77FE7b8e66571E0fca7104c4d670BF1C8d722
   - Gauge: 0x5aeB4e367060EE08F37a7c65F57bA9f1C1895F92
label: bearish

text:
This text provides an overview of the Gyroscope Protocol, which is built on top of Balancer's Maxi LM Multisig and uses Ethereum as its base. The protocol utilizes two rate providers for FRAX and sFRAX, with one being currently active. The E-CLP (Ethereum Composable Market Maker) is called the "CEMM" in audit reports by Nethermind, Trail of Bits, and Runtime Verification.

   The FTL Labs team's multi-sig can pause the pool, change the swap fee, and set the protocol fee, representing potential centralization vectors. The Gyroscope Protocol has been live on Ethereum since the end of 2023, with E-CLPs on several other chains.

   To interact with the GaugeAdder4 at 0x5DbAd78818D4c8958EfF2d5b95b28385A22113Cd, the specified transaction will call the addGauge function with the Optimism root gauge's address (0x7E1726D24B1CD3dFcd713f67a83ccEaa6108d069) as an argument. The gaugeType for this transaction is set to "Optimism".

text:
The text discusses the proposal for PLANET token to be listed on the Isolated Lending Market of Venus, highlighting its potential value addition due to its innovative approach and strong market position. PLANET ReFi is a pioneering project in the realm of #ReFi, partnering with global celebrities to introduce Real-World Assets (RWAs) to Web3. It aims to disrupt the $300 billion Green Tech Market by leveraging the Amazon flywheel revenue model and creating a sustainable revenue stream while fostering social change.

The native token of PLANET ReFi, $PLANET, is in the top 10% across several categories, including trading volumes, social engagement, market cap, and token activity. It has gained significant community support and partnerships with major platforms like BNB Chain, Binance Oracle, Uniswap, Pancake Swap, etc., and is listed on various CEXs.

The benefits of listing PLANET on Venus include the flexibility for suppliers to diversify their accumulation strategies by migrating deposited liquidity from Ethereum and BNB Chain. The potential transfer could stem from significant sources such as CEX, single staking, Uniswap LP (Eth/Planet), Pancakeswap LP (BNB/Planet) and Cake Syrup Pool, among others.

To incentivize the listing, Planet ReFi will offer $PLANET token incentives to increase rewards and attract more users to the Venus Platform. The text concludes by providing essential details such as ERC20 and BEP20 tokens, market cap, and website link for further information.

text:
This text discusses a proposal to adjust the parameters of the Aave protocol on Polygon v3. The main changes include increasing the Base rate from 0% to 3%, raising the Slope1 parameter from 7% to 14%, and increasing the Reserve Factor from 10% to 20%. These changes are aimed at optimizing utilization and revenue generation for Aave.

The table below shows the current and proposed parameters for various Aave deployments:
- Polygon v3: Increase SupplyCap, BorrowCap, Slope1, and Reserve Factor; keep Uoptimal, Base, and Slope2 unchanged.
- Polygon v2 (frozen): Keep Uoptimal, Base, Slope1, and Reserve Factor unchanged; freeze other parameters.
- Ethereum v3 (not yet deployed): Propose new values for Uoptimal, Base, Slope1, and Reserve Factor.
- Ethereum v2 (frozen): Keep Uoptimal, Base, Slope1, and Reserve Factor unchanged; freeze other parameters.

The proposal also mentions that the current borrow rate on Polygon v3 still exceeds the borrow rate at the optimal utilization point, but over time, adjustments can be made to optimize for utilization and revenue generation. The graphic provided shows the changes in interest rates with the proposed changes.

References are included for further reading on the current state of Aave on Polygon v3, the methodology behind borrow caps, and the Creative Commons Public Domain Dedication. Copyright is waived via CC0.
label: neutral

text:
The tBTC token functions as a decentralized, wrapped version of Bitcoin (BTC) on Ethereum, Arbitrum, and Optimism networks. The minting and redeeming of tBTC is managed by wallets created periodically based on governance, requiring 51-of-100 signatures from a Threshold Elliptic Curve Digital Signature Algorithm for movement of funds.

The Threshold Council multisig, consisting of 6/9 Gnosis Safe multisig with 9 unique signers, has limited upgrade privileges over the smart contracts but does not possess any custodial power over deposited BTC. The market capitalization is currently $195,000,000 USD / 2,960 BTC, and tBTC can be traded on various decentralized exchange liquidity pools.

Risk parameters for tBTC include a borrow cap of 2 Million USD, LTV of 35%, LT of 78%, liquidation bonus of 5.00%, liquidation protocol fee of 10.00%, and an isolation mode of No. The community is encouraged to discuss these risk parameters further before making any decisions.

The proposal suggests escalating the discussion to Snapshot stage if consensus is reached, followed by additional stages for feedback collection and final confirmation before enforcing the proposal. The copyright for this proposal has been waived under CC0.
label: neutral

text:
This summary discusses a potential shift in strategy by the Aave DAO regarding its holdings in the Balancer ecosystem, specifically B-80BAL-20WETH. The main driver of this change is the introduction of vlAURA, which offers several advantages such as maximum emission power on strategic assets, shorter lock periods, no decay, and less frequent voting requirements.

However, there are also potential drawbacks to consider, including limited liquidity, potential efficiency issues if the Aura protocol BAL accumulation doesn't follow the vlAURA supply increase, and the absence of veBoost on vlAURA. Other factors to consider include the cost of selling B-80BAL-20WETH BPT, the cost of acquiring vlAURA via OTC deals, potential security and ecosystem risks, dev resources required to add vlAURA support, and review time by BGD for the vlAURA implementation.

The proposal is currently a TEMP CHECK, seeking community feedback and sentiment towards updating Balancer ecosystem holdings for a more efficient solution. If the community response is positive, the proposal will move to the ARFC stage for further discussion, analysis, and finalization. If successful at the ARFC stage, it will be submitted as an AIP for on-chain governance approval. The author of this summary has contributed to TokenLogic & Llama but stresses that this proposal is not requesting compensation from any third party.
label: bullish

text:
The summary provided outlines a proposal by Thank APE to expand their role within the ApeCoin decentralized autonomous organization (DAO). Their goal is to maximize value creation for the ecosystem by addressing its biggest needs more efficiently. They aim to serve three main areas: tech builders, culture builders, and small businesses.

The proposal requests 4.2M APE for a one-year deployment, with 80% of the funds allocated back to the ApeCoin community for value-creating contributions and 20% allocated to service provider fees. The funds will be allocated as follows:

* 3.36 million APE to the community in the form of rewards (1.68M to Tech Builders, 1.18M to Culture Builders, 500k to Small Businesses, and 336k to Emerging Opportunities)
* 840k APE to ThriveCoin, Thank APE Board, and other support services (for protocol and platform design & development, deployment support, partnerships, community, legal, hosting costs, and Thank APE Board Members not part of the APE Foundation)

The full proposal can be found at this link: https://forum.apecoin.com/t/aip-379-thank-ape-phase-ii-amplifying-a-movement/20324. The implementation of the AIP is administered by the Ape Foundation, and any material deviations from the initial proposal will be disclosed to the APE holder community.

The author also mentions that DZAR has the ability to print unlimited amounts of tokens, which could potentially drain liquidity pools, causing large losses and negative publicity. The author concludes that encouraging DZAR liquidity on Balancer poses a significant risk for potential liquidity providers joining these pools.

text: The proposed BIP 87 aims to modify the bveCVX voting strategy by defaulting to selling bribes, with an option for strategic replacement with emissions. Fees for vote weight include support for DAO operations, bveCVX/CVX LP emissions, and BADGER/WBTC CVX & CRV yield. Rewards from bribe selling will be distributed in a ratio of 75% bveCVX and 25% Badger. The changes also include keeping bveCVX for Boost participation and collateral on Rari, while reconsidering the distribution of Badger and cvxCRV emissions to bveCVX unless it's cost-efficient to buy vote weight from it. The forum discussion can be found at https://forum.badger.finance/t/bip-87-bvecvx-restructure-voting-strategy-and-emissions-revised-with-community-feedback/5521 and further details are available at the RFF on Discord: https://discord.com/channels/743271185751474307/899812443201626192/949853044093366313. The sentiment of the text is informative and proposes a strategic change in the management of bveCVX voting strategy and emissions.

text: The text presents a financial strategy for users (referred to as "pancakers") within a platform called Pancake, where users can borrow coins or USDT from a collective pool. The amount one can borrow is approximately 50-75% of their staked cake and the borrowed funds are locked or frozen in Pancake. If the value of the frozen funds falls below the loan amount, they will be sold. This strategy benefits both borrowers (who can access funds without moving them for other investments, profit from red situations, or use in real life) and all pancakers (as they can save significant profits from this pool, attract other crypto traders to stake cake, potentially influencing the cake price, and a small percentage of funds can be burned). Overall, it's described as a win-win situation.
label: bearish
